text: Can 330 ml from OddBins, Notting Hill. Floral aromas with notes of coffee, caramel and chocolate. Pours black/amber body with a beige head. Taste is bitter and hoppy with coffee, burnt caramel, milk chocolate and subtle citrus notes.

Aroma: cubierta de hierba, el lúpulo cítrico, fresco, tal vez un poco de naranja Apariencia :. Negro, casi ningún sabor cabeza :. Paladar dulce luz :. luz a medio amargo que sube, carbonatación media general :. fantástico IPA, uno de los mejores aromas equilibrados. Sabores stout con amargor muy bien balanceado.

Can, 33cL. Home. A sparkling dark brown clear beer with a big beige foamy head ; medium retention ; ok lacing. Fruits (orange, tropical fruits), resin, pepper. Medium to sharp dry bitter refreshing, medium spicy, light to meidum sweet. Medium body, light to medium texture, average carbonation, fruity dry spicy finish. Overall, very good !

33cl can purchased @ Rock Out Shop. Robe brune avec une fine mousse. Attaque sur le café léger et le caramel. On sent bien le malt puis une légère amertume pour terminer. Malheureusement il ny a pas du tout de longueur.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2017 Puszka 330ml .ciemno-brunatny kolor. Piana bezowa,obfita o drobnych pecherzykach. W zapachu dominuja sosnowe akcenty podparte duza dawka chmielu. W glebi mozna wyczuc morele mango i ananasy. W smaku owoce bardziej wyczuwalne.slodki posmak dojrzalych moreli mango i marakuji,lekki karmel. Sosnowo -chmielowy finisz.dobre

Color negro, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de tres dedos de grosor (cremosa y de buena retención). Carbonatación media. Textura oleosa. Aroma torrefacto, con café, pasas, chocolate, resina y cítricos, también un toque herbal. Sabor torrefacto, mucho cacao y café en boca, casi dulce, con los cítricos presentes y un buen balance al final entre un amargor suave y una ligera dosis alcohólica. Resina en boca entre trago y trago. Otra CDA de manual.
Cam from the Cambridge wine merchant. Pours hazy brown. Citrus, orange, apricot, rye, wheat, bread. Palate is chocolate, toffee, bitter cocoa. Bitter finish. Great!
33cl can. black/amber color. medium light beige head. hops, chocolaty malt, liquorice, raisins, hint of citrus. medium bitterness. medium carbonation.

Nose is soapy artificial pine and burnt rubber.
Taste is pine and burnt caramel (but not in a good way)
Cant understand how people can taste chocolate in this.
The problem is it seems Im the only one to taste that.
I usually love black IPAs and I like Beavertown, so I was not prepared for this. Yerk!
Very nice black IPA with a large body and perfect blend of malty sweetness and hoppy bitterness.
Tap dark brown colour with small beige head.Aroma is sweet of berries and hops smooth and mild roasted mouth feels and slight bready finish.

Negro con media corona de espuma de Buena retención, aromas a resina, hierba, cacao, café, regaliz y frutos negros; en boca entrada media, refrescante y amargor moderado, cuerpo medio pleno y ajustada carbonatación, corto retrogusto, maltoso y final dulce, equilibrada y compleja cerveza, correcta y en estilo.
Dark brown/black pour, with beige head. Smells of roasted malts, fruit, coffee. The taste is quite fruity with roasted malts, and light coffee. Good mouthfeel and body.

06-05-17 // can at Naiv Frankfurt. Pours a deep black beer with nice beige head. Nose is hoppy, some sweet malts and coffee. Roasted malts in the beginning, mild coffee, followed by a great bitterness. Great Black IPA!

Was way past due date.

Dark robe. Nose of caramel and coffee. Medium body. Hoppy attack. In mouth some coffee. Bitter finish with notes of green hops and herbs.

A bit shy (maye due to date), but quite balanced and really nice. A good standard black IPA (which is already quite difficult to get)
Na zdrowie, Salud, Kampai, Prost, Skaal, Zivjeli, Fenékig, На здоровь& Na zdravi
Can. Pours a black colour with a fluffy beige head, aroma is light and hoppy with hints of fruit, taste is light bitterness with a dry bitter finish.
Can 0,33. Pours dark brown almost black with big foamy off-white head. Hops, roasted malts, coffee, herbs. Medium body and soft carbonation.

Bottle from Oddbins Hyndland, Glasgow. Beer served in 10°C, Duvel Glass. Pours black with nice medium head. Aroma is smoky, roasted malts, coffee and something skunky, that smells like street cannabis, oxidized hops maybe. Taste is ashy, smoke, roasted sweet malts, creamy with herbal, slightly fruity bitterness.

0,33l can from Beergium shared. Pours almost black color with some head. Flavor of quite roasted malts, chocolate, fruits, pine, sweetness. Quite bitter and thick body, balanced thoroughly, distinct carbonation. Works well, heavy on both worlds.

2016 catch up - Can at home - It was a good black IPA, but, in my opinion, closer to a stout than the IPA. There were hops, but I felt that I wanted more. It was a great mouth feel and the malt was very good.

330 ml can from London Brew Market, Old Spitalfields Market, London, UK. It puts black with a medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, caramel, coffee, chocolate and fruits... Maybe orange, lemon, peach. Very particular. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, carbonation is average. Liked it!
Dark a,ber with firm head. Nose with hops and some citrus on the top. Taste fruity with some almost caramel or fudge to go. Palate rather fresh with hops again. Nice.

7.4%ABV. Black IPA.

Poured out black brown. 36 SRM.

Nose has ripe citrus, pine

Mouthfeel is light juice with pronounced carbonation. Palate has fruit, mango nectar, then brown wheat toast, bread crumbs. Hops are pine, grass.

Finish is brief-medium.

Can. Dark brown beer with frothy tan head. Aroma: roasty, coffee beans, citrus, pine. Taste is light sweet and medium+ bitter, citrus, orange, lemon, light coffee, roasty. Long ashy bitter finish, hint of alcohol. Medium+ body, average carbonation. Nice, complex, a bit too ashy.
Pours almost black, dark brown. Aroma is sweet dark.malts. taste is bittersweet, roast, dark caramel with pine hops. Better than your average black ipa. Not bad
Can from brewery. What an absolute stunner!! So gorgeous, roasted, malty, hoppy, beavertown citrusy. So smooth and creamy. Love it.
Keg @The Hanging Bat, Edinburgh. Pours blackish with a slight redish tinge. Nose is orange, pine needles and lemons. Taste is big malts, slight burnt notes, slight chocolate.
Clear dark brown with a medium off white head. Aroma is piney, resinous with some citrus. Flavor is bittersweet with some sweet coffee and a gentle espresso aftertaste. Medium palate
Drank 28-3 @Majid the night before going to Struise. Not that different from the Gamma Ray, really just the black version of it. Fresh, not too stout-y.
0.33L can at home. Dark colour, fruity close to malty grapes. Nice aroma of dark fruits.

Appearance is very dark brown, slightly ruby tinge, a foamy beige head of around one finger. Aroma- chocolate, caramel malt, milky coffee, chocolate biscuit, hops. Taste- bitter hops, chocolatey malt, coffee, fruity hop undertones, berries, toffee, cherry hints. Full and fairly rich mouthfeel, good amount of carbonation. Bitter lengthy finish. Nice stuff.
Duft citrus frisk meget svag mørk malt smag citrus frisk frugtig svag sødme appelsin svag karamel ristet kant
comment dire si ce nest que cest parfait, en arôme comme en gout , ces arômes/gouts de chocolat/agrumes doublé de lamertume légère en fin de bouche. La robe est dun noir intense.

330 can sent by cesarpball in a bottle swap, many thanks
Pine and lemons is all this black IPA is all about.Very tasty and at the same time very drinkable in a way definitely better than most BIPAs
Can at Dulwich Hamlet FC. Bitter hops, slightly spicy, some fruit and sweet caramel and chocolate. ABV well hidden. Really good beer.
Deep black. Massive, creamy head. Slightly roasted aroma with elements of drop and citrus. Fairly sweet taste with some toffee and a more bitter finish featuring espresso and charcoal.

33cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Zeer donkerbruin met een grote beige schuimkraag. G: Veel citrus, grassig, hars, drop en licht geroosterd. S: Zoetig met een bittere afdronk. De aromas van de geur komen terug: drop, citrus, hars en geroosterde toetsen. M: Stevige body met een sterke carbonatie.
Very good black ipa. Im not fan of of black ipas but these one is very good one really

Hazy brown color with tall, long lasting beige head. Aroma of reisin, caramel and licorice. Taste is medium sweet with licorice and chocolate notes. Stable bitter finish. Well balanced and great experience.
330 ml can. Pours a dark brown with full head. Aromas of spicy resinous hops and chocolate malts. Flavors of pine, resin, bitter citrus and chocolate malts. One for the hop lover.

Pours a beige to brown head with an explosion of caramel, candy, toffee and liquorice aromas in addition to rich hops. Oil black colored body. Mouthful of elegant contained round roasted malts, but moderated thickness. Interesting nose on the whole.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Jan 2017 - Hoppy fruity aroma with chocolate and coffee. Lots of choc in taste with coffe/fruity hop bitter roast finish. Light and drinkable Black IPA
Dunkelmalziger Hopfenantrunk, frisch, geringe Herbe. Steigend hopfig bei konstant malzigem Hintergrund, spritzig. Steigende Noten von Karamell, deutlich bitter. Langer Nachhall. 10/10/11/11/12/11

330ml can. Pours very dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma: hoppy, pine, roasted malt, tropical fruit, coffee. Taste: as the aroma, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, and a lot of hoppiness, pine, tropical fruit, earthy, bitter fruit and coffee flavours. Medium bodied. Excellent black IPA.
Black, small head. Aroma: pine, chocolate, exotic fruits. Medium to full body, medium to heavy sweetness. Malty body, bit of hoppy fruits. Medium bitterness, long finish with lots of chocolate.
Canned 330 ml, courtesy of Miro. Shared with JFK10000. Pours brown with creamy tan head. Chocolate, roasty, pine, hoppy, creamy, smooth, moderate to strong bitter finish. Medium bodied.

Bottle. BCA - sedimented. Opaque Black in colour. Tan head. Very Hoppy; piney resinous hops. Very Fruity; tropical fruits and grapefruit citrus. Malty; roasty malts, chocolate. hint of coffee. Earthy and Spicy. Bitter fruity hoppy and roast malty throughout. Dry into finish. BIPA is not a style I normally like, but I liked this a lot. Terrific Black IPA! (2014-08-31)
A benchmark in a can. Good balance between hops and malts, light and dark, silk and granite. This is now the black IPA to beat, despite its ubiquity. Even better on tap if you can find it.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 Mooi zwart van kleur met crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Aroma en smaken van drop, zoethout, zwarte besjes. Smaakbalans zoet/bitter slaat duidelijk de kant van het zoetere uit. Heel licht bittere afdronk met een zoetje doorweven. Mooie Black ipa. Beetje dun, mist misschien wat body maar smaak maakt veel goed.
Pours deliciously dark. With a fleeting head. Taste is chocalate caramel. The trouble id its not as bitter as id like.

Dark black with a cola coloured head. Some hops, pine and roasted notes on the nose. Taste is of caramel, treacle, coffee, tropical fruits, pine, green fresh hops and cocoa. I was disappointed that this didnt taste like Black Jack sweets which a friend told me it did. Price Paid: £3.15.
Marvellous - coffee, fruity. Looks dark, but is nice and smooth with a slight bitterness that compliments the dark fruit taste. On tap its even yummier.
Mörkbrun med smutsvit skum. Doftar och smakar citrus humle, kaffe och lite choklad. Bra beska

Color ebano scuro con schiuma avorio e pannosa, generosa e lungamente persistente. Al naso note agrumate e di aghi di pino si sposano con note di biscotto al cioccolato e con la lievissima tostatura di fondo. Al palato scorza di pompelmo su una buona base di pane nero, per poi virare sul finale verso un amaro dai toni resinosi. Lunga la persistenza retrolfattiva. Corpo medio, vellutato, carbonazione bassa. Ottimo equilibrio e scorrevolezza notevole.

330ml can. Pours deep brown dark, bit of light coming through, small beige head. Nose is similar to a hopy tropical ipa, with a bit of roasted malt, coffee and bitter chocolate. Mouth feel is velvet, leading into a taste of bitter coffee, dark chocolate, fruity tropical grapefruit and mango, then cascading into a bitter hop finish. Boom. Fantastic.

Can from beerlovers, Vienna. Dark brown colour liquid with beige head. Aroma is piney hops, grapefruit, tangerine and some roasted malty, chocolate, coffee notes, some caramel. Taste is on hops side first, pine, resin, grapefruit, citrus fruits. Some roastiness is notable towards the finish. Some caramel. Higher carbonation. High bitterness. Bitter aftertaste. Excelent black IPA.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2016 Pours deep brownish purple, slightly hazy, with off-white head. Aroma: intense hop aroma, with notes of citruses, pine, some tropical fruits, supported with toasted and toffee like malts aroma. Flavor is very similar: intense hop notes which takes on fruits mentioned above, supported with firm malt backbone, with notes of toasted, toffee, just a hint of dark chocolate and coffee in the background...hop bitterness is very high, but pretty well balanced with malt backbone. Finish is dry and bitter. Bitterness lingers in aftertaste. Body is moderate medium, texture soft, carbonation medium.

Jet black, lingering white head. Aroma coffee, licorice, pineapple. Palate anc carbonation medium. Taste well balanced, tropical fruit mixed with chocolate and not a hint of harshness or overly roasted tones.
Semi-dry finish and alcohol presence non-existent.
Excellent BIPA.
0,3l can. Nose: tropical fruits (mango, pineapple), roasty notes. Taste: juicy, mango, roast, some liquorice. Excellent beer, well balanced!

330 ml can from Wanstead Tap. Pours dark brown with a large, fine, lasting beige head. Lacing present. Hoppy aroma of plums and citrus. Great taste of plums, citrus and dark chocolate. Oily texture, medium-bodied, hoppy bitter finish. Damn this is good.

Black with a tall tan head, aromas with a subtle mix of fruitiness (dark berries) and roasted malt. Light bitterness in mouth. Medium-bodied with a slightly creamy texture. Bitter finish. Very interesting and well crafted. Another great beer from Beavertown.

October 31, 2015. On tap at CBC Covent Garden.
Almost black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted, malty and light fruity with roasted coffee, licorice, peach, dark berries, pine and grass. Taste is medium sweet, soft roasted and grassy bitter. Finish is slightly dry roasted and grassy bitter, light to medium sweet toffee, peach and licorice notes. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Nice one!

W aromacie nuty palone mieszają sie z cytrusowymi, wychodzi troche przypalonego ziarna kawy, takie klasyczne black ipa. W smaku jest wytrawne, dosyć łatwo pijalne z intensywna goryczka, lekko zalegająca, grejfrutowa i palona, posmak gorzkiej czekolady i kawy. Podsumowując bardzo łatwo pijalne jak na 7% i ogolnie jest to super klasyczne black ipa, ciekawe ile lepsze jest świeże, bo tutaj juz aromat był średni, fanom stylu polecam ja średnio lubię

330 mml can as part of the European Local Swap 3/2016 (thanks minutemat). Opaque black colour with a creamy and frothy beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, dried fruits and milky chocolate. Taste is medium to heavy bitter with strong roasted malts and hops. Dry coffee aftertaste. Next one please!
Pours hazy brown, aroma of fruits, grass, lemon and honey, flavor of fruits, grass, lemon skin, chocolate, medium bodied, nice

15/20 initially a hoppy taste before a stout taste takes over. Real depth and long aftertaste. Mild bitter aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black from the can and leaves a creamy, tan head that lingers amidst copious lacing. An attractive looking beer. Aroma is a mix of pine and citrus, but also with light roasted caramel undertones. An interesting mix that in this case comes together quite nicely. Taste is dry, tangy, moderately bitter. Faint chocolate noticeable under the tart, piney overtones. Stays bitter through the finish. Body is medium, carbonation mild. A very enjoyable brew!
UPDATED: OCT 9, 2016 Can. Black. Medium head, medium retention. Aroma intensity 4/5. Spruce aroma. Heavy bitter. Medium body

Aroma: mostly fruity hops with a hint of malt. Appearance: Very dark, close to black in colour with a thick head. The head remained throughout the time I had the beer. Taste: quite complex citrus-y hop flavour with slight caramel and coffee aftertaste. A beautifully created mix of hop and malt to form a lovely black IPA.

Draft @Brewdog, Shepherds Bush. Pours black with a small off white head. Lovely aroma of coffee, chocolate, some hoppy grapefruit and citrus fruit. Excellent palate, medium body, quite carbonated. Bitter and sweet after taste. Not very long. Very balanced, fine bitterness from coffee and grapefruit, balanced with fruity sweetness. Beavertown is fast becoming one of my favourites.

Can at home. Dark brown colour, big white head. Nose is light roasted malts with flowery-fruity hops. Light sourness in the background. Taste is medium bitterness, low sourness from the roasted malts. Nice but feels like a porter.
Pitch black, decent foamy head. Smells good, like a fairly tame IPA. Creamy, smooth mouthfeel... very balanced, not too bitter or too malty.
Dark brown with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of licorice and chocolate with fruity and herbal hoppy notes. Sweetish roasted flavour with caramel and licorice, herbal hops and a solid bitter finish

From 550ml can. Pours black with good latte coloured head which stays for a while. Aroma fruity, slightly metallic. Taste fresh and fruity with slight bitter tang. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from Raynvile store, Leeds. Pours black with lots of coffee notes. Tastes of rich coffee but actually a lighter finish with fruit or citrus notes. Nicer than I expected and good if you fancy something different.

Can. Aroma of grapefruit, orange, flowers, coffee, milk chocolate. 
Pours black with reddish nuances and a beige head. 
Taste follows the nose with nice amounts of citrusy hops shining through. Medium bitterness with a solid sweet and roasty malt backbone. 
Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation, roasty and bitter finish. 
I like that the hops shine mostly on this one. Nice.

Pours with a nice tan head. Coffee, toffee, and dark chocolate notes in aroma and taste. Lots of pine and citrus hops up front, almost juicy in character and balanced perfectly against the roasted malts. Hop forward -- definitely an IPA more than a stout with hops thrown in for some extra character -- which was the original idea of the Black IPA. Definitely one of the best of its style.

- schwarze leicht durchsichtige Farbe
- geringe Schaumentwicklung
- leichte Noten nach Schokolade, Malz und eine Spur Rauch
- geschmacklich dann eine richtige Hopfenbombe ohne 
 je unangenehm zu werden
- eine wunderbare malzige Süße bleibt leicht im Hintergrund
- leicht ölige Konsistenz mit perfekter Kohlensäuredosierung
- im Abgang bleibt der Hopfen-/Malzcharakter sehr gut erhalten
Fazit: Fantastisches Black IPA

330ml bottle from LCBO. 7.4% alc/vol. Pours a deep brown colour with one finger of lasting head. Floral aroma with notes of grapefuit.Taste matches the aroma with a strong hoppy character and subtle caramel finish. Moderate carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2016 A peine le "Shlack !" de la canette émis, que les senteurs de houblons viennent chatouiller les narines. Couleur sombre (sisi), mousse bien balèze sur la durée, et bien crémeuse à souhait. En revanche une fois en bouche, les saveurs de houblons sont totalement bouffées par les notes de cafés. Enfin ça cest le premier avis sur lon a. Une fois les papilles apprivoisées, le tout saffine délicatement... mais pas trop non plus. Cest sympa, mais je suis quand même déçu pour une Black IPA, cest presque une black tout court pour le coup.

Can 33cl. Black with a nice cremy light brown head. Citrus, pine and fresh cut wood aroma. Great taste. This is a truly black ipa, not something in between. The hops are dominant in the taste but compliments greatly with the malts. Soft to drink, but with a nice long finish. Great beer.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, pine, roasted malts and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/dark brown beer with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit and pine; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and hops.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Superb aroma and flavour, but could have been more roasted. This is only nitpicking though, this is amazing.

A pitch black body with a large, well lasting light brown head. Nose is roasty with coffee and chokolate beans alongside some hoppy resin and pine needles. Taste is quite dry and comes to a lingering roasty, bittery dry finish. There remains an intense warmthness in the throat long after each sip, it is quite pleasant. Lively carbonation and moderately light palate. Nice and well balanced but lacks a bit on the aroma hop department.
pours dark with an off white head. boasting a roasty aroma it prepares you for the drink ahead. its smooth sipping and when left to lie on the tongue i get an almost licorice flavor. very enjoyable.

Dark reddish brown with dark tan structural head. Aroma of pine, tamarind, and coffee grounds. Rich malty flavor with a lot of different hoppy notes underneath, including more pine. Quite bitter on the end. I may have finally found an IPA I like.

Can. Pours black, lots of tan head. Piney aroma with a bit of coffee grounds under it. Very bitter, bright flavor, changing to something malty and chocolately on the finish, with quite a lot of acid. Medium body. Lively.

33cl can at home from Oedipus Int. Beer Festival 2016. Nose is citric, roasty. Body is pitch black, head is medium, beige, frothy, mostly lasting, good lacing. Aroma is pine resin, citrus, roasted malt, milk chocolate, dried fruits. Light sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light citric sour. Finish is long lasting hoppy and roasty medium to heavy bitter, further developing hoppy bitter, light alcohol warmth. Medium body, dry texture, fizzy carbonation. Easy dessertish beer, very tasty, great balance, too much alcohol is present for this ABV, nice though.
Tap. Yep top drawer. Thick, lots of chocolate and raisins with a big spliff of skunky hops. Long, bitter sweet finish. Smooth, oily plate.

Fantastically dark appearance with decent initial head. The aroma is certainly not off putting but does not stand up to the appearance.
The taste is strong and deeply earthy. Full bodied with soft bitter finish.
Certainly quaff-able

Can at Woodland Creatures. Pours black with hint of auburn, lacy head. Subtle aroma if smoke and charcoal, which carries into the taste. This is a good BIPA with lots of hops, bitterness, malt, smoke, but a wee bit thin for the abv. Goddamn drinkable though. Another Beavertown hit.
Lata 33cl. Muy densa y cafetosa, espuma cremosa y duradera. Final amargo pero no mucho. Está buena pero éstos híbridos me desconciertan más que gustarme.

330ml can at the Head of Steam, Durham. Dark brown pour with an off-white head. Aroma of iron, and dark bitter hops. Notes of cream, smog, and bitter IPA dominate the flavour, undershot with hints of bitter dark chocolate.

Appearance: Dark brownish/blackish body, with a medium sized off-white to beige head. Aroma : malts, slightly roasted malts, herbal and tropical hops, spruce. Taste: malts, lightly roasted malts, some herbal and fruity hops, moderately bitter, some pine and spruce. balanced. Medium body and carbonation.

Wonderfully fresh and prominent aroma of grass, resin and chocolate. Black body - as the name suggests - pours with a frothing ivory head that settles into large bubbles. Medium sweetness with treacle notes is well matched with a lingering, clean bitter finish. Smooth and oily medium body. A delicious and layered black IPA.

33cl can from cervezalandia. Color is dark brown to black. Head is thin and brown. Taste is medium high bitter, light sweet. Finish is herby and dry. Aroma is hoppy, piney, roasted, chocolate, herby, pinneapple.
Very hoppy smell and taste, warm alcohol, thick texture. The malts are on hold for some time, and then lack the usual burnt malt taste im accustomed to in dark ales. Pretty damn nice
Brown dark color with foam layer. Shy light roasty bitter nose. Dusty bitter coffee taste. Roasty bitter aftertaste.

Can bbe 09/2016. Black with white head. Aroma fresh cascade hops, some caramel. Taste grapefruit with caramel sweetness, finishes with grapefruit and hints of coffee. Nicely balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can. Black, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & abrupt finish.

Medium dark brown color. Nice fruity hoppy nose
Big rich mouth, treacles,Molasses, caramel, milk chocolate, mildly sweet. This is fairly sweet for the style, but great depth. Modest bitterness at the end.

Tap at Brewdog Brussels. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Lots of citrusy hops in the aroma. Dark malt. Med body. Flavor is some chocolate, some dark malt, and a good deal of citrus hop. Very light hop burn. A really good black IPA.

On tap at Brewdog Brussels. Pours near black with a thick tan head and a treacle and citrus aroma. There is a rich chocolate and dark molasses flavor with a dry bitter citrus finish. Stays on the palate for a while.

From can large foamy head that lasts. Dark brown to black color. Smell of fruity hops that reminds me of strawberry banana milk shake. Mildly fruity smokey burbon taste with a bitter but good after taste. I prefer gamma ray and bloodyell but still good.

From can in IPA glass. Nice hoppy nose, citrus with earthy undertones and a bit of mocha. Rich malt taste featuring caramel and aniseed that transforms for the better as it warms. Bam-a-lam, indeed. More please.

A beautifully balanced black IPA perhaps only let down by a slightly too sweet finish. The aroma is of roasted coffee, citrus and a hint of chocolate. The taste includes sweet nougat with coffee, cream, grapefruit and sherbet. It hides its alcohol brilliantly.

Pours very dark brown with good beige head. Aroma of chocolate and pine hops with hint of coffee. Very slight smoke aroma too with some pepper. Medium carbonation and good mouth feel. Taste is hoppy but with a nice light porter edge. Mostly chocolate and light smoke but with good dry bitter hoppy finish
On tap at the Beavertown brewery on Saturday. Didnt write any notes, sorry.

Awesome beer, the aromas are not blowing me away but the look and taste are very well balanced. This can was relatively old but still tasted superb. When I am next in Tottenham I'll be swinging by for a pint of it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kolor:  Czarny. Nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Jasnobeżowa, drobnoziarenkowa. Początkowo dość wysoka, po kilku minutach osuwa się do centymetrowego kołnierzyka. Idąc w dół zaznacza swoją obecność kolejnymi wstążkami. Po zamieszaniu Snifterem odbudowuje się ponownie lecąc do góry. 
 Zapach:  Po przelaniu do szkła wyczuwalne charakterystyczne dla stylu nuty takie jak: spora żywica, igiełki, sosna, las, lekka paloność i szczypta czekolady.
W oddali trochę ciemnych owoców. 
 Smak:  W smaku prażony słonecznik wybija się przed szereg. Razem z nim zabawę urządziły sobie nuty sosnowego lasu i czekolada.
Po paru chwilach przyłączają się do imperezy owoce leśne.
Na końcu języka wyczuwalna delikatna kawa.
Goryczka średnia, palony finisz. Fajne posmaki kawy na podniebieniu.
Black Betty jest pełna w smaku, dość słodka, bardzo dobrze zbalansowana.
Dość gęste, puszyste, wszelakie posmaki lasu wspaniale harcują na podniebieniu.
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Pierwszorzędna Black IPA. 
Beavertown stanął na wysokości zadania i uwarzył bardzo stylowy, konkretny trunek. Aromat nie jest może najwyższej próby, ale smak jak najbardziej nawiązuje do stylu.

Black Betty jest gęsta, pełna w smaku i świetnie pijalna.

Can from Bières Cultes - Rue des Halles. Black body with tan head. Nose of hops, floral, sweet. Taste is also sweet, floral and malts. Vanilla notes. Chocolate in there too. Creamy texture and lots of spices. Good one.

Dark brown body with a medium to thick light brown head. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, roasted malt, caramel, dark chocolate. Taste is sweet and medium bitter. Medium to long body with dry bitter finish, average carbonation, oily texture.
Pint. Impressive balanced black IPA with blackberry aroma and great black colour. Intense chocolate, coffee taste with a mix of caramel and hops

The taste starts with a light malts and vanilla sweetness and, yep, notes of chocolate (only on the first sip). But the hops raise their head immediately with zesty spicy and dank notes. Smooth and spicy from the beginning to the end. Excellent.

W aromacie ciemne słody, czekolada, popiół, szczątkowa chmielowość. W smaku podobnie, dominuje czekoladowe odczucie palonego słodu, lekki sos sojowy, goryczka średnia, odczucia chmielu prawie brak. Piwo w puszce też się utlenia. Szkoda.
Aroma especial para una black ipa que parece anticipar acidez que no se percibe después en boca. Rica, rica.

Can from Appellation Wines. Pours opaque black with a nice fawn head that lasts. Aromas of moss, grapefruit, dark chocolate, coffee, berries. Rich and full-bodied to taste, yet lovely and fruity. Awesome.

Black color, beige head with goos lasting. aroma has roastynotes, black coffee with hoppy hints. Flavor has a decent bitterness, roasted malts, chocolate and coffee beans notes. Good bitterness in the final with good duration on palate.
Can. Dark brown with frothy tan head. Hoppy pine aroma, grapefruit. Grapefruit sweet flavour with long hoppy bitterness

Tap @ Mother Kelly's. Pours dark brown with an off-white head. Roasty aroma. Taste is of caramel, chocolate, a bit of licorice and citrusy hops. Medium body and soft carbonation. Easily drinkable with a roasty and bitter finish. Delicious.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2016 Can. Black with huge dark foam. Hoppy flora aroma. Balanced bittersweet taste with hops, flora and malty sweetnes and notes of chocolate.
Can. Back colour. Roasted grassy hop aroma. Flavour is chocolate, grassy hops. Nice bipa

Praticamente nera, schiuma beige fine e un po vivace. Ottima al naso, tostatura, note di pino, citrico. Grande anche la bevuta, intensa, buona luppolatura su una base dolce e tostata. not for me this one got it from ales by mail beer club dont think i would have it again father in law liked it though

Amazing aroma, fresh pine, red grapefruit, dark roasted nuts. Strong bitter, rich mix of roasted and hop flavours. So well build up, so tasty. Very dry, very bitter. Lrab. (33cl can from Saveur Bière)

Dark brown color with light brown head. Aroma is heavy on the hops with dank, herbal notes but you also get the underlying roasted malts. Taste is sweet at first with juicy hops but gets bitter and roasty on the finish, lingering with grapefruit bitterness in the aftertaste. Body is dense and smooth with medium carbonation. Overall its a really well made and balanced black IPA.

Can. Deep black in colour, small beife head. Aroma of tropical and citrus fruits with strong grapefruit note. In taste lightly sweet, citrusy notes dominate here. Some roastiness in the back and light caramel. Medium body, medium bitter and dry finish. Nice one.

Can at Erzbierschof Monday Club. Yes, a hoppy dark brew, and well done, all characteristics are present throughout. Clearly darker than any IPA, but as hop forward as it can get. Porter notes on the tongue, just for a few seconds. Lota of hops on the long finish, hoppy. Very nice. Really impressive!

Superbe dans son style.
Nez assez gourmand de café plutôt vert et légèrement acide. On perçoit une légère rondeur caramel voire vanillée. On trouve des pointes fumées avec des nuances agrumes.
La bouche a une jolie épaisseur. On a une belle atque café, très ronde, très gourmande. Les houblons équilibrent parfaitement mais ne poussent pas trop le côté IPA. Ils apportent juste de quoi couper la rondeur en apportant un fond agrumes.

Puszka 330ml. Kolor czarny, nieprzejrzysty. Piekna, trwala, obfita piana. Aromat: ciemne owoce, cytrusy, lekkie nuty slodowe. Smak: WOW! Bardzo dobrze ulozony alkohol. Ciemne owoce, posmak domowego soku z aronii, troche lukrecji za ktora nie przepadam, ale tutaj jest ok. Bogata paleta cytrusow. Niesamowite black IPA. Musze przyznac, ze kazde piwo od beavertown, ktore probuje jest niesamowite.

Noire absolue, épais col de mousse à petites bulles "microscopiques".

Arômes : chocolat noire amer, fleurs, notes végétales et résineuse.

En bouche : effervescence très discrète qui la rapporte étroitement dune stout, épaisseur en bouche et rondeur qui y contribuent aussi, bon houblonnage résineux, sec et floral.

Très équilibré, sècheresse agréablement maîtrisée, un must du genre donc.

Pours beautifully with rich, dark colour. The smell is roasted malt, subtle cocoa with hints of caramel. The taste is an evolution of the palate with the right sweetness in the beginning and rich bitter finish. My favourite Black IPA at this moment.

Tap. black with tan head. First Nose Blackberrys and caramel. 
Taste of fruity hops with roasted malt and chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Medium bitterness. Full body, creamy texture, average carbonisation

From a 330ml can on 13/2/2016. Pours the deepest of browns with a medium tan head. The nose features light roasty notes and a bit of fruit. Otra joyita de la casa Beavertown! me encanta el sabor de esta black IPA muy conseguido el equilibrio entre el amargor de la IPA y el cierre a cafe de de una stout

blikje, 33cl, schenkt zwart met schuimige fijn bruine kraag. aroma van mout, chocolade, hoppig, laurier, den. smaken zijn matig zoet, redelijk bitter, chocolade, laurier, den, hoppig, iets koffie, medium body, cremig mondgevoel, goede bipa.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2016 Wow not a lot you can knock this on silky head grass pine berry flavours great fresh pine aroma winner.

Un nez houblonné très présent directement. Les agrumes et le fruit de la passion. En bouche des arômes d'agrumes toujours présent avec des touches grillées délicates.

330 ml can, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 7.4%. Black colour, creamy tan head. Aroma of fruity and piney hops, hints of roast malts and chocolate. The flavour has plenty of piney hops with some fruit, medium dry, also roasty notes of coffee and dark chocolate.

Nice black IPA, bought in Belgium and drank in South Korea. Strong Chocolate, dark malts, grassy, little bit citrus aroma. Medium bodied and carbonated. Chocolate, fruity, hoppy malty bitter finish. Im not sure because this is canned 2 months ago, but I felt this is more likely a porter with hop.

I am a Californian living in Denmark and had a project in Stockholm Sweden: My buddies and I enjoyed The Oliver Twist Pub... With a large list of Tap Beers, I choose Black Betty... Can.Fantastic blend of roasts and fruits which make for an extremely complex but rewarding flavour great
330ml can. Hoppy, roasty black IPA. One of the better black IPAs that I have tried. I would like to try again.

Nice hoppy, citric and floral taste and aroma but with clear burnt and roasted notes. A slight taste of coffee
On tap at CBC15. Dark brown with whiteish head. Aroma is sweet, dark malts and slight roastiness. Taste is hoppy, light , smooth, roasty, grapefruit and wood.

Black with a brown head - Roasted malt aroma with a nice hop aroma in the back - Good malt body with a good hop profile that gives a good bitterness - The bitterness from the hops goes into the finish - This was good

Along with Yves in the Gollem cafe tap black colored body with an off white head and a malt hops dark fruit coffee aroma a fruity dry malt hop coffee bitter sweet taste with a alcholic bitter finish

All In Beerfest 2015: Aroma of grapefruits and roasted malts. Taste is perfectly balanced with a lean towards the maltier side. Zwart met mooie lichtbruine kraag. Mooie hopsmaak en -aroma met gebrande mout, koffie en chocolade. Wel een vbeetje waterig.

Taste is moderately sweet with initial dark chocolate, coffee and liquorice leading towards a hoppy pine citrus finish. Nice mouthfeel and lots of carbonation. Excellent Black IPA.

Draught @ OT. Pours pretty much black with a frothy pale beige mocha head that leaves some spotty sticky trace on the glass while dissipating. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with roasted malts, burnt caramel, grapefruit juice, mango, freshly cut grass, pine needles, burnt wood, moist soil, orange zest and lemon zest. Very solid BIPA. Spot on the style without any aspect dominating. Tasty!

Stunning black IPA from Beavertown, had this in a can at my local barbers while I was getting my hair cut! Huge bitter flavours from the hops and burnt malt, balanced with some coffee and liquorice notes. Big full mouthfeel.

Tap @ Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Black with a creamy beige head, some lacing. Coffe and chocolate aroma with some bitter citrus, grapefruit and bloodorange. Taste got pine and fresh citrus with grapefruit and citrus zest, big smooth rosted notes, chocolate, coffee beans, licorice. Grassy bitter finish.

Pours black with a large tan head. Aromas of peach, grapefruit, roasted malt, chocolate, almonds, brown sugar, citrus. Taste is roasted malts, peach, grapefruit, brown sugar, slight roasted almonds. Mouthfeel is quite dry yrt smooth with medium carbonation.

Can at le sur mesure in Nantes. Black colour with a small beige head. Fruity aroma with a touch of coffee. Bitter ending. Very nice.

Can. Pours a really dark brown with a small beige head. The aroma from this beer is amazing. Hits you straight away. Full of dark malts and hops. Taste is of similar with hints of coffee and liquorice. A lovely bitter finish from an excellent black IPA.

Nice pour with a good aroma of pine and citrus not overpowering.

Tap @ In De Wildeman, sample size. Dark brown color. Beige head, not much. Aromas: resin and some citrus, bay leaves. Ratronasal: drop/licorice, bay leaves, roast. Pours a dark body with a medium head. Very nice hoppy aroma. Well balanced taste of hops with a bready touch.

33 cl can @ home. Pours brown with a tan head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma and flavour are grapefruit, roasted malt, chocolate, and pine - with a bitter finish.

0,33L can (from Koht, Tallinn). Pours dark brown-black with beige brownish head. The head stays. Aroma is roast, coffee, malt, some citrus and alcohol (especially after it warms up). Overall: ok, feels somewhat similar to one of our local craft (Ulg by Põhjala), but somewhat more refined.

Looks.. Dark cola black, sml-med head.
Smells.. Fresh stone fruit hops, some citrus, choc...
Tastes..burnt cola, stonefuits, a real smokiness, burnt grains, coffee bitterness
UPDATED: NOV 10, 2016 Black pour with off white head. Big citrus aromas, light roasted flavours, with a hint of coffee... citrus bitter hops, dry and medium sweet...  well balanced. Great beer.
Dont think this was kept in the best condition, and wasnt poured well. But the hop influence was still there, need to try it again .

Can from Birro Enoteca Losfuso Torino. Pours clear black with a medium, frothy tan head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is earthy roast and chocolate malt, citrus and floral hops with prune notes. Flavor is moderate citrus, floral, and pine hops and bitterness with chocolate and roast malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Bue en canette de 33cl à la brasserie,
Couleur brune/rubis, mousse marron et effervescence moyenne.
Nez sur le houblon,
Une attaque en bouche avec une pointe café, du houblon et du réglisse fin de bouche avec une attaque mandarine, bien équilibré !
Gorgeous aroma of mandarins. Off white head with plenty of lacing over a black beer. Dark malty based roasted coffee bitterness with citrus overtones. Sweet and very dry finish.

Colore nero con riflessi rossastri, schiuma abbondante marroncina.
Profumo molto intenso di resina, erbaceo, fruttato, frutta tropicale, agrumi, leggero pepato e speziato.
In bocca subito molto amaro, smorzato dai toni dolci dei malti che emergono bene prima dellassalto finale dellamaro, lungo e intenso.
Leggere note tostate, che danno una leggerissima astringenza. Ottima.

Beavertown Tap Room on 20/06/2015. Draught 2/3 pint. Black in colour with a small tan coloured head. Aroma of roasted malt, hops and dark fruits. Bittersweet hoppy flavour, with chocolate, a little roasted coffee and dark fruit. Nice bitter hoppy finish. Incredibly smooth.

Black pour, with a slightly beige head. Wonderfully pine aroma, with a big strong dose of roasty malts. This is truly one of the best black ipas ive ever had. Strong notes of pine resin, and subtle citrus fruit with a solid strong roasted malt, with hints of coffee. An incredible example of the style.

Bottle to pint glass
Caramel, spruce, tropical fruit, and pine resin Dark brown with a frothy 3 cm light tan head. The head has moderate retention and there is little lacing. Taste is toasted malt, juniper, molasses, and medium bitterness.
From tap at CBC 2015. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit, malt, citrus, peach and roasted notes.
Black color. Brown head. Intense coffee, chocolaty and herbal character. Also some citrus and fruitiness. Bitter aftertaste.

CAN
APPEARANCE: black beer, nice stable beige head.
NOSE: chocolate, some coffee, mild hops, refreshing though.
TASTE: full rich aroma of chocolate and slight coffee, followed by hoppy bitterness and dryness of dark chocolate and hops combined. Almost perfect in its style

330ml bottle at home bought at Ammersin. black color. medium big tan head. smells fruity, coffee, grapefruit, herbs, pines. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, coffee, creamy / milky, some light sweetness that works great with the coffee, pines, light grapefruit, some grass, resin. finishes with pine and coffee notes and light sweetness. wow, great beer. really love the creamy coffee mouthfeel. love the balance with the bitterness and the light sweet notes.

Pours a coal black color, with a huge, lasting, slightly brown colored head.

Again, just after opening the can my room is instantly filled with tropical hops. After putting my nose to the glass, the beer reveals a fresh hop presence, leading unexpectedly into a grassy, citrus dipped direction. Underneath, chocolaty, roasty malts, together with caramel convert the aromas onto a ripe orange peel, exotic fruit course.

Medium bodied beer, very smooth and easy drinking, with a refreshing hop note during the finish. Offers an unusual pairing of creaminess and pleasant dryness at the same time. 

Tastes of toasted, earthy malts, pushing even further into a Porter direction by adding a slightly sweet toffee tang to the beer, with recognizable sugar to it. This gets coated up by a silken smoothness beded on earth, from which tropical hops become introduced to the palate, changing the beers taste direction completely. The hops do put up the beers initial sweetness, but convert it into ripe fruits and add a decent dryness to it, the longer they stay on the palate, together with a strong malt backbone, remaining its creamy chocolate profile. Finishes with orange and citrus peel on toasted bakers chocolate, blending into a soft dryness.

Unusual composition, with a very pronounced, smooth maltiness and a late hop addition, reminding one, that this is still supposed to be an IPA. The hops do provide a pleasant character, resulting in a convincing teamwork with the malts.

Aroma has a lot of hops and some roasted undertone. Pours black with a small beige head. Taste is bitter and a bit sour with some fruits. Palate has a nice mouth feel. Overall a decent beer with a really nice balance between fresh and malty.
Burk på bishop. Svart med beige skum. Fruktig doft med inslag av choklad. Kryddig humlesmak.

Betty a une robe noireet une jolie mousse crémeuse ... Encore une fois, jaime vraiment bien tant gustativement, questhétiquement. Des bières expressives mais avec tact et délicatesse. Ici cest léquilibre du malt torréfié chahuté par lacide et lamer qui est remarquable .

A lot of rich roastiness that takes away from the bittering hops. Deep rich & hoppy.

Rated by BrewTom

33cl. Can. 
Pours black with tan head. 
Aroma grapefruit, citrus, pine, resin, sweet roasted malts. 
Taste caramel sweets, piney resin bitter. 
Mouthfeel thick. 
Great Black IPA.
Great fruity hop aroma, just a hint of dark malts in the back. Good dry fruits and coffee/black chocolate. Dry finish. Silky texture. I start to like these Black IPAs more and more!
Bottle at London Beer Lab. Brown-black with a thick beige head. Pine and flowers and chocolate and roastiness. Got the balance between roastiness & hoppiness pretty much bang on Id say. Good stuff.

Pours a dark brown, almost completely black, topped with a decently sized and lasting beige colored head. Initially a very short lasting, but very nice fruity aroma, which turns into decent herbal hopp aroma with some roasty and caramel notes later on. Taste has initial sweet feel, followed by roasty body with a decent, but not too strong, bitterness. Herbal finish that goes into a semi-lasting aftertaste. A great one.

Can. (thanks SirLimpsalot)

Black with a medium tan head. Aroma and taste of grapefruit, licorice, roasted malt and some bitter chocolate. Nicely balanced and with a medium bitter finish. A nice Black IPA.

@ Basunen 15-5-13: ganska stor doft med tydlig preg av saltlakrits. Smaken har en fin balans med oljig vätska med tydliga toner av humle och lakrits. En lite lättare eftersmak.

---- Soberness not garanteed!
From the can it puts a nice dark with a decent head. Smells malty and heavy. Tastes sweet and heavy. Chocolate, charcoal, grains, and a dry bitterness. Mills bitterness lingers.
Bottle at bar. Poured a solid black with a finger high white head. Aromas of fresh hops. Florals mostly. Bubbly and bitter, watery palate. Ok

From the dimple in my glass I see a fair bit of haze in a dark mahogany body with a puffy cream coloured head. The aroma gives off a niff of dark cocoa, walnut skins and cola nut. Theres also touches of savoury caramel and carob (I hate carob). These are manifest in the flavour, which should by rights be quite sweet. It has a dash of sweetness, but in the main is well balanced. It has a good body and a lengthy finish that fills the mouth. Its a charmer.

Caoba oscuro prácticamente negro, espuma compacta beis. Aromas de Malta tostadas, melaza, frutas tropicales y pino. Cuerpo denso, sabor tostado y afectado con final de amargor intenso tostado y resinoso.

Very dark brown, practically black, with a decent light beige head. Aroma is floral hops, pine, grass, nutty, roasted malt. Taste is sweet with a nice bitter finish. Oily texture with light carbonation. Pretty good beer.
Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours dark brown with a black creamy light brown head. Aroma is fresh, grapefruits, citrus, pine, light roasted malt. Bittersweet. Medium bodied, average texture and carbonation.
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo NY. very nice black IPA. medium to fuller bodied black pour. Bigger roast than hops but solid bitterness in this black IPA. good mouthfeel, solid flavor, nice

Pours a hazy copper colour with a big frothy beige head, great retention and soapy-foamy lacing. Citrus aromas of grapefruits, but with oranges as well balancing things. Hints of pine and caramel. Nice grassy hops over the roasted malts, with notes of cocoa, citrus and coffee. Not a hopbomb Black IPA, being from England, but a well-balanced hop and darker ale brew. Overall, the hops are well-blended.
330 mL bottle. Essentially black pour, red tinges, small tan head. Citrus and pine aroma. Taste has some roast malt, actually comes across semi sweet. good bitter finish.

Best før 04.05.15. Mørkt brunt mot svart. Herlig duft av bitre frukter og noe vanilje. Markert bitterhet med noe skog og granbar. Veldig godt, men sansynligvis litt friskere om det hadde vært ferskere.

Pours dark brown low head
Aromas of vanilla, fruity hops, chocolate
Taste has malty black malts, dark fruits, caramel
dark brown colour, moderate sized beige-ish head; aroma of citruses, cocoa and coffee notes; taste of citruses, mild rosted coffee, dark chocolate, maybe ash notes, caramel sweetness - perfect

33 cl can, BB 22/06/15.Clear reddishbrown to black color, big lasting tan to light brown head. Malty, light roasted, citrussy hoppy scent. Roasted, bitter, floral stems taste. Bitter, sweet, dandelion aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, high bitterness.
Burk Bishops örebro. Brunsvart kulör. Doft av rostad malt och lite citrus. Kaffeaktig smak med inslag av citrus, bröd och örter

Pours dark brown/black with a thin light brown head. Comes with a floral coffee aroma. The flavour reinforces the floral and citrus notes, supported by chocolatey malts. Fairly clean aftertaste. Good stuff.

bottle. Poured clear dark brown with a red hue and a big mocha head. Aroma is robust with spicy hops. Medium body, tight carbonation with a citric acid finish. Flavour of herbal hops, pine resin and grapefruit atop roasted malts.
Nearly black, huge, fluffy offwhite head. Aroma has pine, resin and citrus. Chocolate and caramel flavour with solid pine bitterness. Quite well balanced.

Tactile little black can of course. Ink-coloured with a yellow tan head curtained with lace. Cranberry, blueberry and coal aroma. Good juicy, eminently belchworthy green stem, strawberry chew and lavender hop character mildly eclipsed with fire alarm toast, burnt pistachio and bitter chocolate.

Can 33 cl.
Hazy dark brown, tan head. Roasted malts, grass and citrus. Medium sweet, dry bitter finish.
A small taste @ One Pint Pub. Pours very dark red with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts and hops, almost acetonic. Flavor is soft roasted malts with grapefruit and hops. Nice.

Draft @ Dukes Brew & Que in London


Appearance: Burgundy body, nice tan head

Aroma: Dark fruit, citrus, pine, mild roasted malts

Taste: Great flavour for a Black IPA, berries, tropical fruit, pine, aniseed, and very mild roasted malts

Palate: Medium body, good bitter finish
Good one. Ive tried cask conditioned. Beer is perfectly smooth, has a perfect aroma, great bitterness. But the mouth feel is rather poor. Too watery.

Canned, Rheged, Penrith. Gorgeous fresh pine and caramel aroma. Jet black, huge foaming head. Sweetness and earthiness coming together really well, soft, creamy palate, late chocolate in the finish with roast notes coming through. Cracking.

Can sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Tom L. Dark brown with a beige head. Nice aroma of fruity, piney and "green" hops, and roastiness. Flavor is roasty and hoppy, piney, fruity, a bit "green", with nice bitterness. Medium-bodied. Nice stuff.

At a tasting, thanks, big bubbly of white head, cloudy dark brown color, aroma of pine, shrubs and some sand, flavor of coffee and chocolate with a piney shrubby bitterness and a light sweetness. Fair, expected much more.

Can @ home from Dekoninck, Vichte - BE. Color: deep black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: very grassy domination. The beer is dominated by hops, with a good malt balanced. Very expressive nose. Taste: nice hoppy and malt balance with grassy notes. Small licorice notes and herbal finish. Very good IPA. Aftertaste: bitter sweet finish. One of the best black IPA that I have ever taste and also easy drinkable ! Good job !!!
Can from Brewdog Gothenburg. Pours Dark brown. Aroma of grapefruit and sweet orange. Taste is a bit bitter with notes of lemon peel. Mouthfeel is a bit thin. Overall an okay beer.

Can from brewdog gothenburg. Pours fairly black with a beige head. Aroma is pretty hoppy along with some roasty notes. Pretty floral, dark roasted malts, weak coffee, chocolate, caramel and weak pine. Taste is bitter and roasted. Notes of crispy hops, roasted malts, citrus and a dry end. Nice black ipa!

Bottle. A clear looking next to black beer with a finger thick beige head. The aroma has chocolate and roasted malts, some coffee and a nice citrusy and piney hoppiness. Theres a hint of alcohol too. The flavor has a pleasant bitterness, citrus zest, pine cones, chocolate, some coffee, roasted malts and a little warming alcohol. Roasted malts and mocha in the finish. Its full bodied and quite dry on the palate, with a soft carbonation. More on the roasted side than I prefer this Black IPA, but its a fine beer indeed. 150402

Can, fresh sweet hoppy aroma, beige foamy head, medium to light silky body, slight liquorice and firm but not too high bitterness. Want to give full marks but it can?t be perfect right... A new favourite.

Tap @TCBW2015. Pitch black color. Small size, beige head, stays. Fart, roast, rye, ashy, citrus in aroma. Not really good aroma. Grainy, roasted malts, fine hops, cocoa in taste. Mix of mellow roast and hops in aftertaste. Nice one!

Pours dark brown to black with two fingers of light tan head. Aroma of coffee, pine, grapefruit, light chocolate and wood. Taste is initial sweet and slightly chocolate-y followed by a rich blend of coffee and blood orange bitter. Very nice. Light yet creamy body with soft carbonation.
(Bottle) clear very dark brown colour with a tall brown head; aroma of stewed fruit, peach, dried lychee; balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish, so flavour full it is almost a DIPA

Brown beer, tan head. Nose is hops and roast, burned notes, citric hops, lemons. Flavor is hops forward, grainy-malty notes are more subdued, some roast, hops and roast in the finish. Pretty drinkable.
9.1.2015. Almost black, big head. Aroma is strong and intense. Plenty of roasted and burnt malts, lots of piny hops. Taste is very malty and piny hops, roasted, maybe coffee. BIPA on the malter side.

Draft taste sample at Alvinne Craft Beer Festival 2015 day 2 (07.03.2015) Vichte Belgium.Jeca, Alberto and Boban.Pour it dark color with small white head.On the nose roasted malt.Taste and aroma of roasted malt, not so good, hops are so killed in this situation, to roasted I think.

Pours brown with an abundance of light brown head. Aroma of biscuit, malt, citrus, pine, cocoa and root beer. Tastes of same: complex, smooth and sweet: am i mixing my senses if i say it both looks like and tastes like a rootbeer float? One of my faves.
Can. It pours opaque black with a creamy beige head. The aroma is tropical fruity and licorice. Citrussy flavor with licorice notes. Long bitter finish. Light ashy notes.

330 ml bottle from LCBO via my bro, served cold in a tulip glass. 
App.: Deep clear brown with a full tan head.
 
Aroma: Strong resinous and piney hops, a little roasted malt, some caramel/toffee, quite nice.
 
Palate: Medium+ body, moderate carbonation.
 
Flav.: Pine that is almost raw...like chewing on a tree, eucalyptus, faint roasted malt, resin, less enjoyable than the nose, but still decent; dry with pretty good bitterness and a long, resinous, very evergreen finish.

Quite the BIPA! I could handle a second bottle.
Black ipa esplosiva, con una carica di luppoli fruttati che si intreccia perfettamente col tostato dei malti, arricchito da note di cioccolato e caffé. Completa, elegante, molto molto più che buona.

Pour is cola dark with a thick, creamy, persistent off-white cap that lasts forever and leaves some nice lace. Nose is roasted coffee and grain, chocolate, piney/floral/citrus hops. Taste is a sweet chocolate malt, caramel, citrus with a bitter coffee/pine/citrus finish. Really drinkable stuff.
Restrained aroma in a purple-black fluid. Full bodied taste has an enticing hint of coffee. Restrained finish leaves one wanting another.

(Beavertown Black Betty) Can 330 ml at home, served into a big tulip, ABV 7.4%
Black colour on the body, tall and thick, creamy, beige head. Very good retention, light lacing on the glass.
Aroma is full of citrus, grapefruit, light tangerine, light coffee and chocolate underneath.
Taste is nicely bitter with citrus, grapefruit, roasted malts, grassy hops, more fruity notes, finishes with a sweet touch, just enough to bring the balance.
Medium thick body, good carbonation, smooth and creamy on the palate.
A very tasty black IPA, greatly balanced between hops and roastiness, between bitterness and sweetness.

Can (33cl): Thanks Tinus: Served in a Duvel glass at 13 degrees Celsius:
Deep dark brown with a creamy beige light brown head.
Great aroma of mostly hops with some hop fruit, soap, and flowers and a subtle roasty note. Very nice and inviting!
Flavour is a delicious mix of fruits, hops, roast, malt roast, toast and chocolate tints, some bitters, floral notes, flowers, and again hops! Freaking delicious and balanced!
Aftertaste is roast, hops, bitters, light fruit, subtle and smolth.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel and more than medium bodied!
Great stuff!
Need a case of this! Im impressed!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Mørk farge, medium høyde på skummet. Aroma av humle, noe kaffe og litt lime/sitron. I smaken er det røstet malt, furu, kaffe, grapefrukt og noe pepper. Litt søtlig først, før den får en kledelig grapefruktbitterhet. Man kjenner pepperet godt mot slutten av ettersmaken. Tynn/medium konsistens.

Can, pours black with stable off-wite head. Intense chocolate aroma with some resin. Much chocolate in taste, light sweetness greatly balanced with medium bitterness. Bit thick feel, soft carbonation, pleasant short bitter finish.

Pours a near black, dark brown with a tan head and quality lace. Dank hop aroma. Not as big as expected, but plenty present. Pine, citrus, caramel come next. Flavor is herbaceous with pine, mint, resin, and chocolate. Lightish body and a sticky mouthfeel. Finish lingers.
This is the one i will drink for the rest of my life, if i have to choose one.

07/03/2015 sample from 33cl can @ ACBF 2015, Vichte. Thanks to Pieter for sharing.
Black with light sticky tanned head. Aroma is roast/coffee, chocolate. Taste is roast, chocolate, some caramel en enjoyable bitterness in the end.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2015 From tap at ACBF. Very dark burgundy colour, almost black, under a sticky light beige head. Citrus peel, bitter chocolate, black pepper and liquorice in the nose, sweetish caramelly malts in the mouth with spicy accents and a firm, long, dry peppery hoppy finish. This I enjoyed a lot, but then I seem to have a weakness for this style.

33cl can from ACBF 2015 on train back home.
De couleur brune foncée sur un léger trouble, col épais crémeux café au lait.
Arôme est houblonné avec pas mal de notes maltées donnant des effluves de caramel, de grillé le tout balancé par une houblonné zeste et fruité.
Palais est également délicieux, léger malgré les 7%, fine note damertume citronnée et légèrement résineuse.
Malt sur la fin pour un côté caramel, chocolaté et grillé.

Just off-white head over black beer. Dry, charcoal, dry hops, aromatic. Dry CO² acidity enhanced stoutish flavour. Finish is more roasted malts. Light to medium body. Quite well-carbonated. Reasonable, if not exceptional BIPA.
Well, some hints of roast/coffee and some assosiation to bread crust. Hops are nice, quite lemonlike. Medium body, foam and carbonation is good. Lovely Black IPA
A decent "Black IPA", good roasted malts and some chocalte at the smell. Fair amount of hops that gets trough.
Not too bad. Solid hoppy taste throughout and after. Pours with good level head and it remains for the duration.

Nearly dark, some red hues, 1 finger creamy head that fades to a small line. Aroma of smile, grapefruit, peach fuzz and roasted malt character. maybe some cedar.Really juicy up front with a lingering tangerine finish. The roasted notes are subdued, some char and orange marmalade. Only a tiny bit of pine resin. Really well balanced

Dark brown - black (~80EBC) with a dark ruby red hue offering a medium frothy light beige head with good lacings. Notes of pine, spruce and resin with faint roasted malts aromas and a light tropical fruit note.
Offers mainly bitter flavours of roasted malts, subtle coffee notes and a certain dried earthy/woodiness with a subtle fruity hint developing some astringency. Soft fizzyness with a light slick texture and a medium body finishing after a while.
Interesting and palatable.

>> Clear sepia pour, thicker, rocky beige head. Intense woody, sappy nose, grilled lemon, heavy roast. Taste is woodsy hops, bitter dark cocoa, dry and intense, aggressive, drinkable, fun beer all around and spot on for Black IPA.
330 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a dark brown colour with an creamy off-white head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee and citrus. Taste is the same. Pretty good beer.

Can from Beermoth.

Pours dark brown with red tint, single finger off white, creamy head. Aroma of Pine, Citrus, Lemon, Orange....chocolate, coffee. Taste of initial pine, then a real earthy hit, chocolate and coffee, then caramel, toffee, citrus, lemon, orange, pineapple, grapefruit, lychee. A great, great beer!
CAN. poured cola black with tan fluffy head. Dark burnt malts & molasses on the nose. Dark malt up front turning into a hoppy bitter dark chocolate back end. Sourced RW
Can, thanks GT2, black pour, tan head, nose and taste are coffee, hops, bitter, awesome
Cask. Dark brown pour, very nice spicy/tropical note, hitn of roast, more roast in the flavor, but a huge blast of hops, really fuckin nice.

2/19/15. Can sampled during RBWG 2015. Deep brown pour with a small tan head, mild lacing. Good aroma, a bit of pine, citrus, earthy, caramel, mild coffee and ash. Okay flavor, char, citrus, earthy, pine. Not bad.

0,33l can. Black,caramel head. Rather mild hoppy aroma with a very mild hint of licorice. Pretty nice. Astringent, fresh. Like a blend of porter and IPA. Might be my imagination due to thr name and colour, though. Quite good. Good mix.

Pours a black beer with a medium beige head. 
Smells hoppy, citrus, pinaple, lychee, chocolate.
Tastes bitter.
Big palate, non alcoholic.
Leaves a gentle hop bitter. 
For a black ipa it lacks some malt bitterness.

Tap at Hopcat Ann Arbor. Black pour with a small foamy head that fades to a thick ring and leaves great lacing. Aromas are dark roast, some char, some chocolate, pine, light grapefruit. Tastes pretty intense. Loads of roast and burnt wood but backed with generous amounts of pine and citrus hops. Notes of caramel and cocoa too. Medium body. Super smooth to drink. Great black IPA.
Cask sampled at ACAT 2015. Slightly hazy dark brown with minimal head head or lace. Aroma and taste is big piney hops over slight roast malt. Clean and easy, but nothing too memorable.

Kind of hazy brown color. Thin off-white head. Nice satisfying pleasant earthy spicy hop aroma, I love that in black IPA. Some dark chocolate, just a hint. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Light dry. Light to moderate sweet taste, moderate bitter. Tasty, unique black IPA. Pleasant spiciness to it, though a touch yeasty.

Can shared at the RBWG hotel bottle share 
Clear dark brown with a tan head, good lacing. Aroma of toasted malts and pine. Flavors of citrus, caramel and pine 
Decent

Can from the Malting Pot. Black, small beige head. Aroma dark chocolate, lemon zest. Medium light body, minimum lacing. Taste well-hopped espresso.

27/I/15 - 33cl bottle @ home - BB: 1/I/15 (2015-116) Thanks to jc1762 for the bottle!
Little cloudy dark brown beer, huge creamy beige head, very stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of forest fruits when smelling the bottle, in the glass its more exotic fruits, malty, sweet, caramel, very pungent! MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: some citrus, very hoppy, bit sweet, caramel, some exotic fruits, soft roastedness. Aftertaste: resinous, little dusty, pretty hoppy, citrus, some exotic fruits.
So, CaN of dark brown black .. Acrid roast and burnt hop sadness .. Ruddy and muddled .. I dont like this, I hurts my feelings and frankly, Im not ok with that. .. Johnny depp got fucked over

33cl can, tasted at RBWG. Kind of hazy brown color. Thin off-white head. Bits of lace. Looks solid. Nice satisfying pleasant earthy spicy hop aroma, I love that in black IPA. Some dark chocolate, just a hint. Bigger herbal. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Light dry. Light to moderate sweet taste, moderate bitter. Tasty, unique black IPA. Pleasant spiciness to it, though a touch yeasty.
Can. Pours a clear brown with small off white head. The aroma is roast and smoke. Thin mouthfeel with strong smoke and roast. Ram jam dr owl!

Dark, dark brown with small mocha head that recedes to a film. Magnificent aroma - strong toffee, resin, pine, some citrus, licorice. The taste comes fairly close to living up to the aroma too. Sweet molasses, rye bread, lots of resin and pine, a little charred meat. Medium bodied and oily. Really good.

number 1200. Frothy head with a darker brown colour. big hoppy pine cones with resin, caramel and light roasty aroma. More of the same hoppy notes with resinous texture and a bit of toasty bitterness on the finish. Big, enjoyable. Very pleasing to taste.

Burk köpt @ Be Hoppy, Madrid. Mörkt brun öl med ett stort "vispat" smutsvitt skum. Dofter av kaffe, choklad och en del frukt. Smakinslag av lakrits, kaffe, röda bär, citrus, karamell och läder. Underbar beska. Stor och fin kropp. Mjuk munkänsla. En sagolikt bra öl.

330ml can at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Thanks Kostas! Black color with beige head. Heavy hoppy aroma, pine, spruce-juniper, spicy. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. No roasted malts in aroma and taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

330ml bottle from lcbo. Pours a hazy, dark caramel/brown with a solid finger of khaki head. Aroma is noticeable after opening the bottle. Floral pine, resin, and citrus mixed with hints of roasted malts and chocolate. Taste is bitter. Starts out with resin, pine, and citrus, then moves to roasted/burnt malts, and ends with an mix of espresso bitter and resin. Medium body with a medium-high carbonation. Resiny in the mouth with a very dry finish. Overall not bad. Resin, pine, citrus, and very roasted malts.

On tao at Tria Taproom. Pours pitch black with a one finger tan head with excellent head retention. Aroma is of citrus, pine, herbal hops, coffee, licorice, roasted malts, and some spicy hops. Taste is pine, roasted malts, herbs, licorice, citrus, coffee, roasted malts, bakers coco, molasses, and some sweet malts. Has a medium-full body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi-moderately bitter, semi dry, medium-long finish. Overall, a fantastic black IPA from a Brewer I never heard of until now.

Can. And what a fantastic surprise! This brew has it all: strong smell of liqourice, herbs and grass, a full round explosive taste of malts and hops and an impressively long aftertaste. The best bipa I have ever had.
Tap @ Mikkeller and Friends. Pours pitch black with a small offwhite head. Aromas of malts, caramel, strong hops, light coffee. Taste is light hoppy, malty, licorice, some coffee, caramel.

Tap @ BrewDog Helsinki. Almost black beer, creamy latte head. Chalky charcoal roast, raw cocoa, floral and juicy, slightlyt acidic roseberry hop notes, resinous at the same time. Quite complex aroma. Rather sturdy maltiness, liquid white bread, salty soda flavors. Greasy chocolatey aftertaste with salty liquorice, grains and biting, herbal/resinous bitterness. Medium to full body, probably enhanced by salts. Low carbonation, soft texture. A complex beer. Very nice, not your typical black ipa.
Pours totally black with a beige head. Aroma is malt, roasty, chocolate, coffee, fruit and hops. Taste is medium sweet leading to a roasty and hoppy finish. Very good.

Probably the best Black IPA Ive ever tasted. Very very similar to my favorite black IPA which is Dunhams black IPA. Everything I want from a black IPA is there. So delicious. Perfectly balanced, the hops are giving a little pine taste but very light and the black side of the beer is creamy roasted coffee. A must buy. Wish I had more.

Pines, some resin, chocolate soft roast. Pretty nice black ipa. Soft, full, malty chocolate.-- bb

Pearl-fawn persistent and fluffy head. Ultra dark brown body. Garage fundamental lacing.

Jan. 31, 2015. Bottle from LCBO. Biscuity, hoppy aroma. Dark black with off-white/tan head. Bitter coffee flavour. Not great. Couldnt finish my glass.
Tap at Mikkellerbar Stefansgade. Dark brown/black with a beige head. Aroma of dark malt, toast, fruit and pine. Taste is dark malt, light roast, hint of chocolate, fruit, pine . Good aftertaste.

De color negro suave coronada por una espuma color café con bastante retención y que va manchando el vaso a la medida que la vas bebiendo.
Aromas a pino y algo de café, muy fresca y aromática.
Cuerpo medio.
En boca entra amarga, un amargor cítrico, acompañada por el torrefacto de las maltas. Suave y ligera, sin presencia del alcohol. El amargor se prolonga tras cada trago. Espectacular,

This is very good! Pours black with a huge almost gusher head and tons of lacing. Nose is very fruity like fresh grapefruit and some candy. Flavours of fresh grapefruit, some brown sugar, lots of roasted malt. Maybe a bit more sugary than Id like. Taste is med sweet med bitter. Full creamy body with lively carbonation and a lasting bitterness. Really good!
Joli bouquet houblonné en arôme. Bière qui nest pas trop dans lexcès. Le .goût de houblon est bien présent mais lamertume est faible. Bière qui se boit très facilement.
Nice hoppy bouquet as expected for a black IPA. Creamy mouthfeel. Could drink heaps of this brew at a slight cold temperature.

mini growler from beer table pantry, NYC. Pours black with med khaki head. Aroma is pine, roasted malt, citrus, chocolate. Flavor is bittersweet, roast / dark chocolate, grass, citrus. Med body, super resinous hop spans aroma through aftertaste.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna z rubinowymi refleksami. Piana drobna, obfita, długa.
AROMAT: Na pierwszym planie cytrusy, dużo cytrusów (grejpfrut, limonka, pomarańcz) W tle aromat karmelowo-ziołowy (cukierki ślazowe), owoce leśne, żywica, lekka czekolada, bardzo wyraźna słodowość (jęczmień). Genialny aromat!
SMAK: Bardzo owocowe (owoce leśne), delikatna czekolada, cytrusy i słodowość (jęczmień). Goryczka średnia do wysokiej. Wysycenie średnie. Alkohol świetnie ukryty.
OGÓLNIE: Rewelacyjny aromat i pełnia smaku to najkrótszy opis tego kapitalnego piwa! Jest w nim wszystko to co lubię w dobrym Black IPA, czyli aromat jasnego piwa oraz smak jasnego piwa z delikatnymi akcentami ciemnych słodów.
UPDATED: APR 6, 2015 At pivni in York, truly awesome, black but tastes like all really solid American ipa. Fruity, hoppy, awesome

330 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in an IPA glass. Pours ruby-chestnut with a tall beige head that remains and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has big notes of pine and citrus, along with toasted malts, brown sugar and perhaps a hint of chocolate. The flavour is fairly well balanced between medium sweetness with roasted malts, molasses and perhaps tobacco on the one hand and moderately bitter resinous hops on the other. The bitterness picks up towards the end and lingers through a long, aromatic hoppy finish. On the palate it is medium in body with a slightly dry texture and average carbonation. Overall, an excellent black IPA with a beautiful complex hoppy nose that carries through to the finish. 2015-02-02

Draft. Dark brown body with medium beige head. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some roast, light chococoffee. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some roast, caramel, light tangerine. Medium body, light resin, stickiness.

From tap @ Zakład Usług Piwnych
Deep brown colour with medium beige head, nice lacing. In aroma there are lot of piney, herbal alnd citrusy notes, and very light chocolate. There is also a sunflower note, that is common in a black IPA. In taste its rather sweet with hoppy and earthy refreshing bitterness and what is good, if you close your eyes it tastes almost like an IPA. Good job, one of the best Black IPA ive tried.
330ml bottle at home, from AleselA, Glasgow - opaque dark brown near black, good tan head, pine, earthy, citrus aroma, good film of fine lacing, viscous, earthy, alcohol, hoppy, good carbonation

Pours extremely dark red brown with a roaring foamy tan off white head. Clear and becoming cloudy at the bottom of the bottle. Fantastic lacing. Nose of roasted grains with a whiff of smoke. Pine tar, modest alcohol, molasses, wood and fruit cake. Very solid balance between the roasted malts and the fresh juicy hops. Lemony cola flavours, sitting alongside British porter notes. Lightly salty sponge toffee. Carbonation is ample and very appropriate, lifting what could be a very heavy brew. Warming alcohol. Bitter Chocolate. Palate is clean and relatively simply done. Crusty brown bread. Dry finish. Very approachable and confident brewing. Label looks and feels great. Definite American influence.

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: aroma is pine, herbs, dark chocolate, and earthiness. Taste is moderately bitter. Pine and herbs at the front, but then the aftertaste is much more dark chocolate. Some pungent fruitiness in there as well. Quite complex.

330ml bottle. Pours opaque black with hug cream coloured head which leaves a lot of lacing. Textbook black IPA. Big IPA aroma. Packed full of zingy citrussy hops. At first the taste is citrussy hops and gives way to malts. Lingering bitter finish. Nice.

From a cask at the 2015 Atlanta Cask Ale Tasting.

This is basically an American Black IPA made in the U.K. It has a robust contribution from a mix of Western (USA) hops. Better balanced than most ales of this style, the hops and dark malts blend more than clash.
Dark brown colour, good beige head with lacing. Aroma of roasted malts and tropical fruits from hops. Sweet taste with sour, roasted and ash note. Tropical fruits also, too low bitterness (herbal).
Draft at Clinton hall NYC. Pours a deep black color with a healthy thick head that lasts. Full bodies and very flavorful. Very nice balance of hops and malt
roasty, spruce, citrus, toast, coffee, black, hazy, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, salty, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Brown pour with a HUGE head. Aroma of pine, coffee, resin, a bit grassy as well. Nice balance here between pine resin and coffee bitterness balanced out with a toasted malt backbone. Medium body, slick mouthfeel, great drinkability for the style. - and I made it this far without a single Ram Jam reference!

Deep black pour with a tight tan head. The nose is a little bit hoppy and fairly roasty. Has a touch of grassiness and a fairly hoppy finish. A little bit woody with a touch of pine resin. Fairly hoppy and rich with a bit of peppery character. Has a little bit of lingering bitterness and a grassy hoppy finish. Solid brew.

33cl can. Dark brown colour with a generous tan head. Pine, roasted and light coffee in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is bitter but with nice roasted and sweet notes. Overall, a very good beer.

Draught at Torst. Black with huge dense rocky head and full sheet lace. Aroma is big full pine and dank hops and lush malt and grain bed. Taste is cedar, smoke, and malt sweetness balancing near bracing bitterness. Feel is velvety full and alive. Probably the best BIPA I have had.

Bottle from the LCBO. Cloudy dark brown with a huge lingering Khaki head that leaves lots of fine lace. Nose had tons of pine and citrus with a good helping of dark fruit over a roast chocolate and toffee. Medium bitter throughout with a toasty nutty backing. Medium slick mouth with average carbonation and a lingering bitter finish. Nice
How: Can Appearance: Dark amber, off-white head. Aroma: fruit, caramel, toast, light coffee. Palate: Medium body, smooth carbonation.
Dam good! Genuine black IPA. Super Hoppy like a standard IPA but with some nice roasty flavours

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2015 Mrs Tiki brought this one home for me from the LCBO. Pours black & proud with one one of the larger -- 3+ fingers deep -- caps Ive seen in awhile. Nose is earthy hops. This is a great black IPA: muddy bitters on the front end & followed through with a great hop juice arc & brisk finish. Grab one of these if you can get your sticky mitts on this one.

Kolor: ciemno brunatny, nieprzejrzysty. Piana: średnia, szybko opadająca ale utrzymująca się długo do poziomu ok. dwóch milimetrów, beżowa, zwarta. Zapach: bardzo intensywny, świeże cytrusy, grejpfrut, mango, lekka żywica i sosna. Wszystko ładnie zmieszane z lekką kawą i palonością. Prażony słonecznik. Zapach bardzo czysty, wyraźny. Coś pięknego. Smak: nasycenie średnie. Bardzo bogate, dość słodkie i gęste. Goryczka w tym piwie przeważa nad wszystkim, bardzo wyraźna, wysoka, lekko zalegająca, grejpfrutowo-łodygowa ale przede wszystkim przyjemna. W smaku wyraźne cytrusy, grejpfruty, mango, lekko kwiatowy i iglasty posmak. Następnie mamy paloną kawę i lekką czekoladę. Wszystko bardzo ładnie, idealnie zbalansowane z lekką agresywnością goryczki. Bardzo dobre piwo.

Draft at Churchkey. Clear dark brown color, beige head with spider web lacing. Beautiful aroma of fresh pine needles on a coffee ground background. Taste is bittersweet pine needles dipped in chocolate dipped in espresso. A better example of a Cascadian Dark Ale than many similar beers from the Cascade Mountains. Delicious.

Bottle from the LCBO. BB Sept 2015. Pours a chocolatey brown-black colour with lots of tan head. Nose is full of piney hops. Taste is hoppy for sure but cocoa/roasted malt is present. Citrus/piney hops, bitter and fruity. Good merger of the styles!

Dark brown pour with a tan head, smell is strong and of hop resins and sweet fruit. Extremely nice aroma. Very creamy palate, lots of hop flavours dancing on my tongue, a bit of roasted aftertaste. Great beer!
Bottle from LCBO. Aroma of tropical fruits and toffee; great! Rich malty taste, tropical fruit notes, bitter finish. An unusually smooth black IPA.

Can, bought at Brewdog Camden. Very dark brown. Hops, liquorice, pine in the nose, almost like hop pellets in the nose, Very green, hoppy, dry and bitter taste, followed by some roastiness. Medium body, long, roasty finish. Good, but could do with more roast.

330ml bottle. Pours a murky, hazy dark brown with a huge head of fine creme bubbles. Wow. This smells incredible. Strawberry jam, papaya, some resinous notes, cotton candy, with a tiny bit of black licorice underneath. Taste wise, its all hops all the time, and beautifully carbonated. Out of the gate, resinous notes, big Fishermans Friends like flavours, with some metallic notes underneath and a faint taste of oregano that leads into more menthol, and some tongue numbing spice. I wish it tasted more like it smelled, but its still pretty darn solid. Id buy it again.

330 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a murky orangey brown with good-sized light tan head with nice lace. Aroma is fairly roasty with citric hops and some hints of pine. Flavour is roasty and nutty with pretty pronounced hoppiness both citrusy and piney. Lingering bitterness in finish. Nice.
