The head is robust, the body black. It smells hoppy, roasty, intensive, natural, handcrafted. The taste is roasty, yeasty, hoppy-intensive, aromatic, intensive, sweet-hoppy in the aftertaste. Delicious!

Bottle from the LCBO. Dark brown with a lot of haze and a big tan head that leaves a nice bit of lace. Great aroma that has the deep roasty malts and frisky citrus and pine hops I want from the style. Flavour is sadly a bit mudded, though - starts well with nice roast malt and toasted nut notes, but then some coffee character comes through that struggles a bit against the building hop bitterness in the finish. The individual components are all quite good, though, but later in the glass it seemed to come together a bit better. Or maybe I was just getting buzzed from the well-hidden 7%. Whatever the case - while it didnt rock me quite as much as its namesake song, but its still a solid beer.

From LCBO, drank at Ian's flat in Toronto. Muddy dark nut-brown pour. Sudsy beige head with big bubbles, watery lacing. Smells of herbal hop, resin, freshly cut grass, slightly sour, bit of nutty dark malt. Tastes sour (unfresh?), grassy hop, some spice/dried fruit, sharp and Body is slick but sharply sour and fizzy. Aroma is interesting but taste is too sour - maybe an old bottle?

Bottle from LCBO at Ian's in Toronto. Hazy brown pour with foamy head. Aroma is intense fruity grassy hops - some roasted malt in the background. Taste is nice but a may not be that fresh - a bit of sour/plasticky taste. Still a good amount of hoppiness - resin and grass mostly. Smooth palate. Not bad but would like to try a fresher bottle since most Beavertown beers I've had have been great.

Mildly chocolatey aroma. Malty aromas. Gorgeous dark appearance. Really smokey taste. Very strong. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, citrus, chocolate, orange and grape. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long chocolate, citrus and grape finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Draught at Brewdock, jet black with s thin head. Aroma of toasted hop. Flavour is sweetish hop, a little toasted fruit finish.

Draught at CBC 2014. Opaque black liquid with a medium tan head. Aroma of coffee, bread, light ash and citrus. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of coffee and light ash. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Bit low hop presence, otherwise good.

330 ml bottle. Dark brown, practically black with a nice, creamy beige head. Aroma of dark malt, toast, fruit and lots of pine. Flavor is sweet, smooth dark malt, light roast, hint of chocolate, some citric fruit, strong pine flavor and nice, balanced bitterness. Fine body and pleasant aftertaste. A well-made, nice, easy to drink black IPA.
Pours black with tan head. Aroma is hoppy with pine, balanced with roasted malts. taste has hop, finishing off with roasted malt and coffee, long finish.
black with a brown head. nose: fruity, hoppy, roasted malts. taste: caramel, dark malts, dark fruity. MF: dry, bitter sweet. good MF, carbonated. I do miss something in the finish. good black IPA!

In tap at Chmielarnia, Warsaw, Poland. Dont know if its pubs fault, but there is no carbonation in this beer what so ever. Taste: a bit sour. Malt - chocolate, cocoa, hops - citruses. A bit too warm...

Beautiful roasty notes, white chocolate mixed with piney and citrusy notes. Completely black, tons of carbonation with a foamy off-white head. Tastes nice, extremely hoppy and packed with flavor. Upfront lactose sweetness and roastyness, finishes with an intense leafy/piney bitterness and burnt notes. Medium creamy bodied, average carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is grapefruit, roasted, fruity roasted dry taste.
Bottle 33cl. Black with a nice light brown head. Dark fruits, grapes with some roasted sence. Medium bittersweet taste with a soft fruits and more burned end. Nice

Flaska från Stirchley Wines. Smak och doft av humle, malt, citrus, grapefrukt, rostade toner, apelsin, granskott, kaffe, choklad, läder, laktris, tropisk frukt. Krämig, rund och len, torr, lagom sötma, fin fruktighet, med välbalanserade och välkomponerade smaker. Beska med smak av grapefrukt och granskott. Riktigt gott det här!

[5948-20131019] Cask. Hoppy orange aroma. Slightly hazy, brown black body with a quick foamy off-white head. Bitter toasted hops and light pine notes in the flavour. Medium-full body. Delicious. (8/3/8/4/17) 4.0
(Cask Days 2013 @ Brickworks, Toronto, ON)

Many thanks to ThirstyBird for sharing this can!  Intense floral in the nose. The beer starts very roasty-floral. Malty, great intense with nice fresh floral hops on a smooth and roasted body. Pine, burned malt. Very sticky and easy to drink at the same time. Great! The aftertaste is long, smooth, fresh and burned. Quite dry with a rest of sweetness. Great Black IPA! 14/13/14/13

Many thanks to bobinlondon! Pours a very dark brown with a tan head. The smell is roasted malt, pine. The taste is lightly roasty, mild pine, dark malt ending dry and a bit bitter. Light+ in body with elegant carbonation. Im not usually a huge Black IPA fan but Beaverton does a great job on this one.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2016 330ml can. Aroma of chocolate and citrus fruit and pine/herbal the flavour is similar. On the palate the chocolate notes are somehow milkier and less bitter than in some Black IPAs. Quality beer.

Flaske (bb okt-14), hjemme: nesten helt svart, og med et flott lysebrunt skum som varer helt ned. Opp fra dette stiger en veldefinert skogsaroma - einer, kvae og furu. Smaken er også like innbydende, med grapefrukt i tillegg. I grenselandet mellom ipa og porter, og meget god. Tørr avslutning med lang ettersmak hvor bitterheten dominerer uten å bli ubehagelig.

Transferring some earlier reviews from my blog to RB. Märts 2014, City Beverage, London (£ 3,00), 33 cl. Kastanipruunika varjundiga must, vaht rohke, ebaühtlane ja hele, kleepub seintele. Lõhn... faking hell kui mõnus: mõrkjas greip, ülivärske ja veidi troopiline ning männiokkane, punase sõstra hapu. Maitselt mõrkjas ja vürtsikas, meenutab pisut üleküpseid vilju, nt ploome. Kehalt sametine ja ülipehme, hästi kerge, pea olematu mulliga - kurgus tekitab pisut kihelust vaid humala mõrksus, kuigi see on pigem (magusa apelsini) magususse peidetud. Suhu jääb täidlaselt vaigune tunne, kõrri mõnus soojus. Lummav kraam.

En perfekt black IPA, med en lett gjenkjennelig tropisk duft. Fin balansert mellom kraftig humlesmak, tropisk frukt, karamellmalt og bitterhet. Leskende og frisk. Kan drikkes mye av. Plusspoeng for intens sort farge og rikt lyst skum.

Can - dark chestnut with a big light brown head which stubbornly insisted on filling up most of my glass. Leaves some fairly thick lacing. Aroma of roasty malt, chocolate, cocoa, fresh grassy hop, tangerine and lemon. Taste of lemon, grapefruit and mango complemented by some bitter roasted malt. Medium body, low carbonation. This was definitely something special.
A perfect black IPA. Richy malts and strong sharp hops. This brew has sold this bizaar fusion style to me. Wow.
Black IPA's rule. Quality brew. The head went a bit nuts on me though (phrasing). Quality bree though. Nothing over the top. Balanced. Could drink shitloads despite the abv
Thats an excellent example of a black ipa. Hoppy and fresh aromas, nice bitter taste, with some roasted hints. Very very nice.

330mL can. Pours black with a big off white head and an incredible toffee/tropical fruit/floral aroma. A perfect balance of light dark malt and heavy hops on the flavour, lots of that tropical fruit comes through with a nice toffee/treacle like backing. Amazing beer.

Pours black with large tan head. Lasting thick lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, bitter dark chocolate, roast. Beautiful blend of IPA and roasted malts. 
A little mango in the flavor, not present in aroma, more grapefruit. Replaced slowly by roasty malts. Dark chocolate. A little oily in palate and a wonderfully roasty citrus finish that gradually builds.
Nothing unoriginal but blended immaculately.

18/10/14 330ml can from The Bottle Shop Bermondsey, pours a deep silky black, large off-white head. Aroma, hops, fresh floral, almost dandelion & burdock. Taste, nice hoppy flavour, bitter finish and a soft carbonation. Rather nice stuff, so had the second can!

From 345 ml can. Pours a deep black with a thin cola-brown highlight at the edge and a thick cappuccino like head. Aromas of pine needles, black coffee, dark chocolate, raisins and prunes. Taste is latte coffee at first before a very firm pine resin bitterness washes through. Dark chocolate and rich coffee overlaid with some lighter fruit flavours toward the back end. Just a touch of smoke at the very end. Smooth, rounded mouthfeel. Coffee and dark fruit in the lingering aftertaste. Great stuff.

Bottle, bought @Alesbymail. Pours dark brown to black with a small, staying, creamy beige head. Aroma has soft roasted malts, a bit of licorice, citrus, pineapple, apricot, peach. Low carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has luscious chocolate, softly roasted. Quite elegant hoppy freshness, citrus, peach. Firm, but still somewhat soft bitterness.
Black color with beige head. Aroma of citra, hops, some malt. More IPA than stout, so very refreshing. Very bitter aftertaste which lasts very long. Good stuff.
Can from Sandinista, manc. Dark brown, tan head. Grapefruit, roasty malts and resin. Bitter and a bit smoky. Slight prickle and a bit of oil.

Can from Hopology, Nottingham. Pour is black with a caramel foamy head, aroma is pineapple, tropical fruits, sweetness. Taste is coffee, malty, pineapple, light bitter finish with some pineapple sweetness, medium body, soft texture and gentle carbonation. Very good
Black with creamy head. Noble hop aroma, quite resinous and earthy. Flavour is also hop dominated although some dark malty notes sneak through in the finish.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Cervezorama 2.0. Color negro. Sabor a lupulo, malta tostada, ligeramente a regaliz, muy ligeramente a cafe.
Keg at Dukes brew.Pours black with thin head.Roasted malts.licorise,reinous with bitter aftertaste.very good beer

Tropical fruits, licorice, citrus, some overripe banana and coffee in the aroma. Dark brown to black with a tan head. Medium to heavy sweet and medium + bitter. Full body with a soft carbonation. Overall a really nice Black IPA, good balance between the styles.
Can from Deliciously Different. Dark brown, creamy head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and liquorice. Nose of citrus and grapefruit. Light sweet, harsh bitter finish. Good.

Bottle at home. Has a deep brown to black colour with a big, beige, creamy head. Has an imidiate hoppy aroma with grapefruit, grassy hops, pine, oranges, leather, roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Wow, theres a lot going on here! The flavour is hoppy with fruity hops, grapefruit, oranges and pine, and fades into roasted tones with coffee. Has a slick mouth feel, and a medium bitterness. A really tasteful and delicous black IPA. The fruity hops and roasted malt melts nicely together in this ale.

Pours a dark brown/black with a thick foamy head from a can. Has the aroma of malt and bread with just the slightest citrus hint. Has a very nice strong bitter aftertaste, the initial taste I am struggling with but is very pleasant.
Heavy and solid beer. Could have had even more of the hop. A bit hard to indicate what kind of food this beer suits the best.

Very dark brown, going on black, with a tan head. Very thick foam from a gushing 33cl can. Roasted malts and fruit in the aroma. The taste is fiercely bitter with tons of grapefruit, juniper and resinous flavours. Some roasted, burnt wood flavours. A very powerful IPA, without the intense coffee and liquorice flavours of a porter, but with some attractive roasted notes.

330ml bottle: BBD 1 Jan 15, drank outside the Wild Card Brewery Tap Room where I bought it on 13 Sep 14. Dark brown to black body with a huge taupe head that produced some impressive lacing. Interesting from the start this brew has loads going on in the aroma and taste. Fruity hops, citrus notes, roasted/toasted malts, chocolate, coffee and woody flavours abound in both senses. A very pleasant beer indeed.
Bla k witj huge almost White head. Ipa aroma. Taste is mix of ipa and some roastyness. Medium bitter. Light carbonation. Medium body. Dry finish
Can from great grog, edinburgh. Black color, big tanned head. Aroma is balanced roasty, fruity and hoppy. Taste is same. Nicely balanced, roasty and hoppy.

Can from Euston Tap, drank from the can on a train to Brum. Dark brown (I think) with a cream head. Plus the can art is pretty sick. Nose of pungent hops, some roast malt. The can prevents serious nosing but suffice to say I like it. Taste of sweet burnt sugar and roast malt, hints of coffee and dark choc, licorice. Good whack of resinous piney and citrus hops here, lovely. Medium body, oily, quite sharp carbonation, lingering hop bitterness and roast notes. Bang on really.

Deep chestnut color, quickly fading beige head. Roasted malt nose, coffee, fruity, brown sugar, chocolate, herbal. Coffee and resin taste, sweet malty, chocolate, dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Can at Dukes Brew Hackney. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is fruity, slightly sour, roasted malt, citrus, some coffee. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour, roasted notes, fruity with citrus. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Very good.

Can in the CBC Clapham. Colour is opaque very dark brown to black, off white to beige head. Nose is big and complex. In fact this beer has a hell of a lot going on. Big fruity hops, citrus, tropical, black grape juice, then roasted malt, chocolate, pine, coffee, earthy. On the flavour its citrus grapefruit, black grape juice, tropical fruits, earthy, pine, dirty, some plasticky phenols, roasted malt, chocolate. Theres a lot going on in here and some of its a bit dissonant as many black IPAs can be. This is somewhere between sublime and a bit odd.
Rødbrun klar med høyt kremete beige skum. Salt lakris, sviske, mørke frukter og mørk sjokoladelukt. fruktig bitter sjokolade og humlesmak. ettersmaken er medium lang humle, sjokoladebitter.
Høyt beige skum,rødbeter klar farge,lukt av lakris og sviske,utpreget smak av salt lakris,god ettersmak

A thick and compact yeast pack sits in the bottle, yet it produces up bright and shimmering. The body a deep ruby, cola brown with a fine and tight bead. Creamy, lax off-white dollop atop lasts and laces well. Piney, resinous, forest floor hops meets scorched coffee beans, twiggy bark and clappy phenols. Wow - really produces on the palate. Huge presence, perfectly balanced. There is hints of vanilla and chocolate icecream, tawny bark, nut husks, roasted malt, charred wood seamlessly tied to piney, resinous hops and an all-encompassing bitterness. Rounded, pronounced. Firm bodied, moderately carbonated, great length where it softens just a little but resides for oh so long on the palate. Quite spicy to add to it all. Thick, full. Lots of dark chocolate. Delicious. (33cL, no date stamp, Cellarbrations Carlisle)

Pours black with cappuccino head. Very balanced aroma. Loads of roasted malt, coffee, tobacco and green hops. Creamy and vinous palate, almost like an Imperial Stout. Aftertaste is sweet, bitter hops, floral, coffee and lingering roasted finish. Overall: Wow, this is craft beer. Challenging, extremely balanced and enjoyable.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Aroma is of strong tropical fruits, some citrus, and peach. Pitch black in appearance. Taste is a explosion of tropical fruits, chocolate, grapefruit, citrus and some maltyness to finish. Nice lingering bitter finish. Lovely!

Bottle at home from mchughs. Pours dark brown lasting tan foam head. The aroma is really something else. Huge pine, resin, spruce, dry earth, some roast coffee. Fantastic. Flavour is coffee, earth, lactose, orange rind, grapefruit bitterness on finish. Really balanced with a creamy mouthfeel. Low carbonation. Full of flavour on a medium body. This is really good.
Fantastisk god black ipa, kaffe, mango, appelsin, tropiske frukter. Helt svart og mørkt flott skum. God og bitter avslutning. Smaker gjerne denne igjen :)

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Manglerud enjoyed at home
Pours dark brown, black in glass, massive creamy tanned head. Smell of citrus, toast, zests, dark malts, hints of ash. Moderate sweet, more toast and citrus, hints of roast and coffee, dark malts. Medium bitter with a tail of citrus and zests. Quite nice BIPA

Can. Black, with big tan head. Great orange and grapefruit on the nose, bit of chalkiness, mango and light ash. Juicy as you like upon tasting: loads of mango, orange and grapefruit. Light roastiness comes in, some bitter coffee, big pine resin rises. More minerally chalkiness. Solid bitter resin and grapefruit juice. Medium/full body. Roasted malt and dark choc lingers, as does piney bitterness. Great gear.
Aroma is dominated by tropical fruit hop aroma. Paste again is dominated with hop flavours and a hint of roasted malt. Beer finishes on the bitter side.

Clear, deep brown body with a red hue and a beige head thats fairly long-lived. Strong and hoppy aroma of tropical fruits (pineapple and mango) with lightly roasted malty notes in the back. There are pleasant hints of caramel and traces of chocolate. Strong flavour of tropical fruits, again pineapple and mango, lightly roasted notes a bit more prominent than in the aroma, pine needles and dry coffee in the back. Light to moderate sweet taste and a pretty heavy bitter and long-lasting finish. Mid to light bodied, fairly oily texture and moderate carbonation. Amen.
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 2 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Storo, Oslo]

330ml Can - Black with a foamy head. Liquorice, fudge, roasted malt and soapy hops in the aroma. Roasted taste with grain, fudge, liquorice and some slightly soapy hops in the finish. Not as hoppy as the aroma suggested it would be, but very drinkable and nice all the same.

Bottle purchased from Sourced Market, St Pancras. Very dark brown with a bit of transparency. Lots of carbonation with a messive creamy khaki head. Huge aroma of pine, molasses, citrus with hints of clove, liquorice and grass. Taste marries a fairly heavy sweetness with a crisp bitter hop flavour. A bitter finish and aftertaste with salt liquorice notes. Body is thin but the lively carbonation ensures a refreshing, moreish palette.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2014 Black with chestnut highlights and creamy, lacey, steady cappuccino head. 4
Big, resiny, fresh hop nose that opens to reveal a touch of ash. 4.25
Black currant with a touch of cocoa and cola then sugared grapefruit and light pine hops. 4
Roast and spice finish and spearmint linger. 
Round, smooth, almost medium. 4
4

Surprisingly sweet and aromatic hop profile - not big IBUs or bitterness. No hint of the strength. Not the hop monster I might expect from Beavertown. But integrated and way drinkable ABA without too much roastiness or general aggression. 

2nd tasting is not as sugary - a lot of licorice-herbal cough drop - but still dark and dank with no real citrus.

Bottle. Dark Dark Brown, Almost close to full black colour with thick beige head. Smell of smoke, laces, blackberries. Taste like Blackberries, blueberries, Smoke, tree and floral. light sweetness. medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation, astringent finish.

Brown to black body, lasting head. Aroma is somewhat mild on hops, well balanced with malt sweetness. Taste brings forward the hops, fruits, mixed with coffee, liquorice and cara. Not too much of anything really. Lasting bitterness. Maybe missing a bit on the hop aroma. Easy and "light" to drink despite 7,4.

This is another solid dependable Beaverton beer, a very good black ipa that my husband also adores, dark, slightly carbonated with appropriate head and lacing to match. I have had in bottle and can from bottle shop, Canterbury.

Pours close to black with a small and creamy dark tanned head. Roasted malts, caramel, pine and resin on the nose. Some sweet notes and faint liquorice. Well balanced taste, has bitterness from the hops and roasted malts and sweet from caramelized malts. Very nice. Coffee notes and bitter hoppiness lasting. Just above medium bodied with medium co2.

Bottle. Black body with a nice offwhite head. Aroma of pine, fruity hops, bubble gum, licorice. Taste evens it out with roasted coffee, licorice, and a fruity hop explosion. The hops in this beer really tickles me, a really nice blend. Very enjoyable!

Bottle with the original pyramid label, pours deep black-brown with a lasting fine crema and aromas of resin, black treacle and very faintly of smelling salts - its a waker-upper, for sure. Wonderful rich, roasty and aromatic body, Light, and bright, yet burnt and warming.

Can. One of nicest pouring beers Ive had for a while, great colour, great head, nice lacing as I drink it. Its all of its bitterness, but I found that its just to sour at the top and in the finish. Id have liked more warmth from malts to even that out a bit, which is the worst thing I can think of to say. I can see why it has many fans.

John, thank you for bringing this to me and keeping me lazy from not crossing the pond (wink, haha, love you bro).
This was poured into a pint glass.
The appearance was a black color with a moderately half fingered white to off white foamy head that once it dissipated, there was barely any lacing.
The smell was somewhat oily citrusy/bitter grapefruit with a decent roastiness about it.
The taste followed the previously mentioned flavors.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a sessionability that wanted to show its face but honestly I was sipping this for the most part. The carbonation was there but wasnt overbearing.
Overall, for the most part, this was a good Black IPA that I would have again.
Bottle. Bought from Selfridges in Birmingham ( expensive ). Black with a small head. Hoppy with some maltiness. A dangerous beer.
Draft - Medium dark roast and piny hops. Cloudy dark brown with a rich brown head. Roast and grapefruit with a bit of bitterness in the finish. Not bad.

330ml bottle from Drinkstore. Tis black/brown, huge foamy lasting tan creamy head. Pine resin hops, backed by chocolatey, coffee notes, subtle enough behind those big hops, but definitely there. Lovely flavour, sweet light chocolate up front, followed by bittersweet coffee in the finish. Light in the mouth, strangely so a really unique mouthfeel. Tight, fizzy carbonation, long bitter cacao finish. Noice.
Heavy chocolatey flavours dominate this beer. Murky as the devils armpit. A decent crash course on black IPAs

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet served in an IPA glass. Two finger light brown head. Foamy, altmost creamy. Body is almost opaque. Dark reddish brown/black body. Aroma is mostly hops, a little sour. Fruity, but with some soy sauce, smoke and basement aromas. More like a stout on the tongue. Salty, deep bitter aftertaste. Pretty good, but I feel like this one falls between two stools. Its the wrong kind of bitterness for a stout, and a little to dark for an IPA.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2014 First rating: Huge beige head. Opaque black body goes hazy dark brown at the
edges. Fruity earthy gooseberry aroma with bergamot notes.
Sweet, and kind of dry, earthy strawy gooseberry taste with spicy
notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft, slightly mealy mouthfeel. Dry
earthy spicy gooseberry aftertaste with roasty herbal notes.
Nice, mellow, drinkable, harmonic, and fairly vivid. Really
enjoyed this. (0.33l bottle, from Vinmonopolet Oslo City.) 7,4,7,3,13=3.4

Second rating: Big brown head.  Hazy dark brown body.  Roasty earthy gooseberry aroma
with spicy wooden notes.  Dry-sweet roasty resiny gooseberry taste
with spicy chocolatey notes.  Fullish body.  Mild, soft, mealy
mouthfeel.  Dryish roasty earthy spicy aftertaste with chocolatey
minty notes.  Lovely.  My type of black IPA.  (0.33l bottle, from wine
monopoly, Strømmen.) 7,4,7,3,14=3.4 again

Bottled. Typical good soulful black ipa fumes an amalgamation of dark texture and floral aromatic notes: grapefruit. pine. Woody. Rich hops. Roasted chocolate. Fucken nice. Looks like a stout. flavours pine. Roast. Chocolate. Spice . Oaty creamy vibes.very easy to sink. Compact good black

DWF; Pours dark brown to black with a creamy, lacing, off-white to tan, lasting head. Nosetrils fills with roasted malt, caramel, tropic, pine, chocolate and spice. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter and light spicy with a lasting bitter, sweet, balanced finish. Body is medium, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft. Sweet, bitter, Betty, dark, hoppy and delicious.

from Mark and Spencer, London -
Black beer with a moderate foam left, solid hoppy aroma of licorice, black cherries, roasted malts underneath, full-bodied, some initial malt seeetness and a solid bitterness, more licorice and other hoppy tones in the finish and apparent alcohol as well

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Pours black with a thin and creamy, white head. Very similar to a Guinness. Malt, ripe fruit, some alcohol and milk nose. Medium body and carbonation. Some warming alcohol. Dry ending. Medium bitterness. Red fruit, malt, some citrus and hop and some pine flavour. A very, very good brew. Seems more like an hoppy imperial porter to me though.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Aroma: Hoppy, black currant, fruity. Taste: Hoppy, citrus, coffee. The finish is dry and bitter with some notes of coffee.
Can 33 clear from AbM @ Toivola. Pours clear dark reddish brown, huge beige head. Citrus, roasted notes in the aroma. Cocoa, roasted malts, citric hops in the flavor.

Can from AlesByMail.co.uk. Dark brown body, with a big, creamy, very stable, tan head, that leaves a ring-shaped lacing. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, nuts, earth, grass, citrus, tangerine, tropical fruits like mango and lychee, slight pine. Taste is pretty similar, great balance between dark malts and fruity hops. Mouthfeel is medium to full, oily, with a moderate carbonation and it finishes bitter, roasty and citric. Simply a tasty Black IPA, one the best Ive had so far! It isnt overly exceptional, but it offers everything I expect from this style, has an almost perfect balance and lovely, complex aromas.
Tap at Mikkeller Victoriagade. Pours, black with brown head. Aroma of roast malts and hops. Some smoke. Taste is Roasted malts, fruity hops, smoke, some oak? Balances nicely. Great brew
Bottle 33cl. Creamy latte colored head. Dark brown color. Aroma is hops, fir branches, resin, nettles and watermelon on speed. Taste is bitter like a ton of spruce shoots.

Bottle from the Vineyard, Belfast. Citrus aromas moving into sweet roasted malts and then coffee and chocolate. It poured a deep black with a gorgeous creamy tan head that left lots of lacing for most of the drink. Citrusy hops in flavour with a lightly smoked roasted malt aftertaste. Highly recommended.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 14/7-14. Hoppy and a bit fruity, grapefruit, light acidic notes in the flavor, medium body with an oily texture.

14.07.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly roasted, dark malts, old leafs, hops, pine needles, grass, licorice, coffee, caramel. Taste is slightly dry roasted, old leafs, dark malts, grass, hops, pine needles, burnt caramel, cardboard, licorice, coffee. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry grassy mouthfeel. Nice enough.

Lovely aroma, hop hit on the nose as soon as I cracked the bottle open. Then some dark roast smells after pouring. Decent head with a nice caramel colour. Good carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel. Fruity and roast taste wise, very well balanced

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from Cornelius. Dark dark brown, light cream/tan head. Lovely lacing. Great pine and hops nose. Clean mouthfeel, taste of grapefruit, faint resin, lightly toasted malt. Nice finish with bitter chocolate. Really damn good.
Almost black. Dense and persistent beige head and lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, pine and juniper. Very strong taste along similar lines. A hint of dark cocoa. Round mouthfeel.

This was enjoyed sociably and I wasnt taking notes, but I - and my fellow drinkers - recall it being bloody fantastic; really moreish, really well balanced, complex and refreshing; Ill be buying more and paying more attention next time. Id had two previous Beavertown beers and been underwhelmed, but this dismissed all thoughts that the brewery might be just overhyped Londonist scene shamsters.

Blacky brown color with beige medium-vanishing head. Aroma is intense, hoppy, minty and piny. Taste is incredible with roasted malts, hops, pine and grapefruit. Aftertaste is bitter with chocolate and coffee hints. Outrageous beer.
Bottle at Tollboden. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is hop, malt, coffee, pine. Flavour is hop, roasted malt , coffee, pine, cocoa. Medium body. Nice beer.
Bottle pour. Really incredible aroma. Hops and mint. Pours a very dark, cloudy brown. Medium bitterness, nice and hoppy, incredible balance and strong finish. Very good.

Bottle from a cool little bottle shop near Camden that I cant quite remember, into a Teku glass. Lovely off white head, opaque black. Oh yes, straight to taste, sweet, fruity, bitter chocolate, great session beer on a slightly cooler evening. Slight creamy texture, very hoppy and puckering. Demands attentions....very nice.

330ml bottle thanks to Ashton McCobb. Pours black with a thick, creamy off-white head. Big hop aromas, pine, citrus, resinous. Light roast. Taste is all about the hops, faint chocolate. Good black IPA for me.

33cl bottle from Cork and Cask.
Appearance - opaque black with a slightly off white head which hangs around for a while.
Nose - pine and orange with a background chocolate and roast. 
Taste - orange chocolate. Then creamy chocolate-coconut notes. Then an unrelentless bitter note, like pickled lime goes on for ages.
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy texture and the finish is just too bitter for me. 
Overall - on style, I think it unfortunately doesnt tick all the boxes for me as the nose is not chocolately enough. However, the taste does also deliver some chocolate but then the palate is slightly too bitter for me. Interesting beer but would like it to be more balanced.

Bottle at Tollboden. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of pine, some roasted notes, chocolate, floral notes and citrus. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some pine, bitterness and chocolate. Medium body, average carbonation.
330ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique 020314. Poured a dark brown/black with a big foamy head. Malt and hops dominate both aroma and flavour. Almost creamy texture in the mouth.

Bottle from the Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Pours black with a tan head. Wow, this is a really tasty number. Starts with a little sweetness and lots of fruity hop flavour. Grapefruit and pineapple. The roasty malt flavours come in on the finish with coffee and chocolate. Superb.
Beer like this makes me emotional. It was a wow. Strongly hoppy. solidly bitter. I love you Betty!

330mL bottle at Euston Tap, pours a near black with an amber tinge and a medium beige / tan head. Aroma brings out rich roasted malt, some light metallic notes, and citrus hops. Flavour is rich and delicious, with a great balance between roasted malt and piney hops. Loads of depth with everything in balance. Excellent beer.

if you ask me which is the best black IPA Ive ever had, my answer is: Black Betty. 
very dark colour and thick body with a nice white head. it looks like a russian imperial stout, but when you smell it, the aroma has all the complexity and fruitiness from its heavy hoppiness, added to (and perfectly balancing) the roasted coffe and chocolate tones. The flavours in the mouth are even more interesting and complex, with dark fruits notes, grass and pine, loads of coffe and dark chocolate, nice roasted hints and it also has a subtle and interesting smoky backtone (very subtle though). The alcohol is perfectly hidden and it just gives an impression of barrel aged undertone. The nice carbonation and the hoppy finish, makes this beer very drinkable and refreshing too. what else would you ask from a black IPA?

Draught at en Öl och Whiskeymässa 2014, 2014-04-11 Göteborg 
AR: tropical fruity, roasted malt
AP: dark brown, frothy snow white head
F: brown sugary, heavy grape fruits , dry, heavy grainy, coffey, wee metallic

On tap at The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Black color with a thin off-white head. Aromas of pine, grass and some citrus. Taste of chocolate and malts with pine and citrus balancing it. Bittersweet aftertaste. Medium body with low to medium carbonation.

(draught) pours a clear amber-brown colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of milk chocolate, fudge and caramel, with a hint of hazelnuts, some bubble gum and cherries. flavour is mostly roasted malts and caramel, slightly sweet, with notes of fudge, oranges, herbal hops and a hint of alcohol in the light-bitter finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with average carbonation.
Pours dark brown with good head retention. Floral nose, fruity hop flavour, with restrained dark malt flavour. Beautiful beer.
Great bottle design. Not necessarily my favourite style but a fantastically balanced beer with a citric hop hit, resinous liquorice flavours, medium texture, bitter finish.

0.33l bottle. Looks nice with a big lasting and lacing beige head on top of a deep cloudy an dark near black body. Mild hoppy nose. Not to much roastiness or darkness over the nose to be honest. Tones of burned caramel and some pine. A nice fruit soap also located here. Light resin and hints of vanilla. Yeah, I like this aroma. Its clearly not super fresh, but it smells really nice. My, thats one flavorful and delicious tasting black IPA! Inky darkness before it hits you with lots of hop fruitiness. Much more dark and roasted in the taste than what it was Im the aroma. Slightly burned tones of hay and malts. Light dry licorice and some paper hints. It contains lots of flavor this. Light oily in the mouth and its just below average on the carbonation. Ends softly mouthdrying and lingering on the hops. Really nice stuff. Wouldnt mind having this fresh. 15.03.2014
On tap at the Three Tuns, Bristol, February 2014. Almost black in colour with a slick of a head and moderate fizziness. Big, citrus hops, toasty malts, some chocolate and a dryish finish. Very good.

On tap in the Redwillow bar, Macclesfield. Almost black with a medium biege head. Nice citrus hop aroma, more in the flavour, nice chocolate, smooth palate, resinous medium bitter finish, very tasty and I loved it.

Visual: Pitch black. Creamy, tight tan head. Clinging strings of lacing.

Nose: Dandelion and Burdock sweetness. Fruit Salad sweets. Slightly smoky. Very roasted backbone.

Taste: Burnt toast, caramel sweetness. Dark chocolate. Sweet, refreshing hops. Hugely bitter finish.

Mouthfeel: Syrupy but not heavy. Plenty of tiny bubbles. Drying.

How: Draught.
Where: BrewDog Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Coffee, fruit, liquorice, hops.
Body: Full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Coffee, liquorice, some citrus, a little bitter, floral. Bitter finish and rather sweet.

Bottle thanks to sarky northerner. Hazy brown colour thin tan head. Aroma is Grapefruit pine good hops. Taste is similar great dark malts long bitter finish. Medium body nice oily mouthfeel. Great BIPA not quite on the same level as the thornbridge wild raven!!!!!!! ( sarkynortherner)

Keg at Holyrood 9a.
Thin off white head, good lacing, clear dark body with hint of ruby. Nose of grassy hops. Flavour of roast nuts, some pine, good bitterness on the finish. Mouthfeel is thick, viscous, chewy, good but hard work after a bit. A really good beer.

Aroma: High hops, fruity, guava, passion fruit. Medium malts, caramel, light grassyness, 
Appearance: Dark amber body. Medium off-white head. Fine bubbles.
Flavour: Fruity, medium sweetness, medium-high bitterness. lingering bitterness. Well balanced. toasted. medium-high maltiness. cacao, line pine, 
Palate: Medium body, creamy carbonation. Light warming. Smooth, 
Overall: Highly enjoyable. Well balanced. Not a quick drinking beer, but a great beer to enjoy slowly, over or after a great meal.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre
14B. American IPA (Black)

Keg at BrewDog, Stockholm.  Hazy dark brown, creamy head. Rich sweaty nose with black currant and passion fruit. Sweet with full body and rounded mouthfeel. Cane sugar, black cherries, passion fruit. Long finish with mild resiny bitterness. Intense, concentrated hop flavours, perhaps too sweet.

330 ml. bottle. It pours a brown color with a thick khaki colored head. The aroma jumps out with potent piney and fruity hops. Slightly weedy and floral as well with hints of root beer and black licorice. The flavor has lots of weed, florals and licorice all-sorts to go along with a thick body. Strong floral bitterness in the finish. Great hop character, but I wouldve liked a little more Citra in the flavor. The body was a bit thick for my taste too. Nice sipper.

On bottle at Beer14. Black color, good offwhite light brown foam. Immediate hops, coffee, licorice; high aroma intensity. Full body & high complexity . Good bitterness & balance. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample from bottle at Beer14. Pours black with a beige head. Nice hoppy and fruity aroma with nice roasty notes. Citrus, licorice, hints of coffee, chocolate and pine. Moderate to medium sweet with lovely hoppy and mild roasty flavours. Delicious BIPA!
Dark brown with a beige head that stands until the end. Aroma: hops. Taste: hops and black chocolate. Very tasty, very beautiful and a really good beer.
330ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, exotische Früchte. Geschmack röstmalzig, Kaffee, exotische Früchte, schokoladig.
Deep red to black body. Medium with a finger of nice beige foam. The aroma is of hops, burned malts, some chocolate, some coffee, some pine and citrus. Same taste, some hop oils too.

(Bottle) Black ale with a decent off-white head. Theres a maltiness to the aroma but the grapefruit edge of the citra hops cuts through it too. The flavour is an interesting balance, with the citrus, hops and fruity malt making for an unusual combination which works very well. Itd work equally well as a more warming pint in the winter (with the toasty malt flavour) and a summery one because of the light fruit. Very nice.
Draught at Mikkeller&Friends. Pitch black - offwhite head. Burned malts. Sweet notes. Fruity. Citrus. High bitterness. Oiley hoppy body. Dryness.

Bottle. Aroma is classic Black IPA style, roasted complemented with load of hops. Dark in colour. Taste is very nicely balanced, roasted malt and hoppy bitterness with sufficient malt background. Very good.

Bottle @ joes shared by me. Dark brown to black colour with a medium sized off-white head. Smells very hoppy, fresh, some onion/chives (probably citra hops). Tastes like a black ipa should taste. Hops, roasty, bitter, some chocolate, some coffee. Very nice! Medium to full body, nice carbo.

Bottle shared by Dutchdrebus @ weekly tasting. Opaque black color, medium sized off-white to beige head. Aroma is lovely: malts, slightly roasted malts, hops, spruce. Taste malts, lightly roasted malts, nicely hoppy, moderately bitter, some pine and spruce. Quite well balanced. Medium body and carbonation. Very nicely done.

Draft. A black beer with a lazing brown head. The aroma has notes of citrus fruits, roasted malt, and bread. The flavor is sweet with chocolate, alcohol, roasted malt, and bread, leading to a dry and bitter finish.
Bottle. Dark brown color with medium beige head. Strong hoppy aroma. Dark malt in taste followed by nice portion of piney hops.Tasty.

Flaska. Farba ako brown ale. Na black IPA je farba prilis svetla. Vona velmi prijemne vyvazena, slad, chmel, jemne v pozadi alkohol. Chutovo je to paradne pivo. Vyvazenost sladu a chmelu je fenomenalna. Lahko karamelova, ovocna v pozadi chmel. Osviezujuce pivo, ktore by som vedel pit kazdy den.

Bottle at Behind the hills beer tasting 2014. Pours brown cloro, beige head. Aroma of hopps, roasted malt, citrus. Taste is medium bitter, roasted malt, grapefruit, orange zest. Nice roasted bitter finish.
Dunkel mørkebrun farve med lyst skum. Lukt av humle, kaffe, sjokolade og malt. Smak av malt, anis, kaffe og humle. Import.

Min#900
Fin duft av humle, lakris og karamell. Mørk grå farge, nesten sort. Tynt lag skum. Nydelig smak av lakris med en liten syrlig fin ettersmak.

Bottle from the Grumpy Goat in Reading. Black with a small, fleeting bubbly-creamy head. Zesty citrus aroma. Nice blend of hops and dark malt. Smooth for a fairly strong beer. The citrus isnt overdone so it works.

Bottled, 330ml from House of Trembling Madness, York. Black with off white head. Firstly there is a fusty note to this, a little note of funghi, flat yeastiness, this moves on with a dark chocolate flavour, coffee and then a pleasing blast of citrus hops, good and tangy. An improving beer through the glass.

Bottle thnx to MannyGoldberg, cheers! Pours a black beer with a small beige head on top with much lacing on the sides. Aroma is perfectly combined with both influences of hops and malts. Chocolate and citrus with touches of caramel. Very nice. The flavor is nice bittersweet with the bitterness overwhelming in the finish. Long, bitter finish with touches of dark chocolate. Very nice brew. Great.
Keg @ Dukes Brew & Cue. Pours a silky black with a dusty coal aroma. A resinous bitterness with great hoppy citrus elements, all balanced exceedingly well. A captivating black IPA.
More aggressive than the Brew Dog. Bigger hops through most of the palate with the hops very much a resiny new world fashion. Very fresh and challenges the roast and bitter chocolate nicely.

330ml Bottle. Dark brown/black, very thick. Small, lasting light brown head.
Roasted malt aromas of dark chocolate and coffee, with a notable floral and orange character. Hints of spice and aniseed. A smooth and creamy mouthfeel, with an oily texture. Initial flavours of espresso and rich caramel, with hints of dried fruits, slightly smokey. Finish is a bitter citrus, combined with a dark chocolate flavour. Slightly spiced, with notes of licorice. Excellent BIPA
From a bottle. Pours like cola, thick lasting dark creamy head, hoppy aroma, rich bitter chocolate and coffee flavours, thick and dark this is an amazing beer. I love this stuff!

Flaske 0,33l spandert av Rune og delt under samling hos ham 6 Feb 14. Svart. Litt farget skum som etterlater en pen lacing. God ferskenaroma. Smaken er fersken & plommer. Avslutter litt tørt. Bra - men litt uvariert. KI=2

Glass, 4-ounce, cask, Cask Days at Toronto, savoured on October 19 2013; eye: black, opaque, tiny sheet of tan head, no lacing; nose: roasted barley, coffee, bittering hops; mouth: roasted barley, coffee, astringency, burn barley, bittering hops, acridness, finale in roasted barley with presence of bittering hops, full body, below-average carbonation, mildly bitter, lightly oily texture; overall: quite fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Verre, 4 onces, en cask, Cask Days à Toronto, savourée le 19 octobre 2013; il : noire, opaque, petite couverture de mousse fauve, pas de dentelle; nez : orge torréfiée, café, houblon amérisant; bouche : orge torréfiée, café, astringence, orge brûlée, houblon amérisant, âcreté, finale en orge torréfiée avec présence de houblon amérisant, corsée, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement amère, texture légèrement huileuse; en résumé : bien bon

Bottled. Pours black in color with a thick and creamy tan head. Notes of citrus, cold coffee, bitter chocolate and grapefruit in aroma. Chocolate and grapefruit bitterness in taste. At first this seems like a combination that wouldnt work that well together, but in this brew its combined in a tasty way. Light tropical fruity sweetness, bitter grapefruit and notes of chocolate lingering beneath in aftertaste. Smooth and very pleasant to drink. Nice, but one bottle of this brew is enough per session.

330ml bottle picked up at Sourced Market, St Pancras in London. Fair, bubbly fawn-coloured head. Deep rosewood coloured body. Inviting smell of citrus mixed with dark malts. Fine blended taste profile of red fruits, caramel malts and liquorice, and even a backdrop of chocolate. Ends up with lingering resin-like bitterness. Fine bodied. Shared with Finn. Very much to my liking (Tromsø 06.02.2014).

Bottle @home. Black pour, thick tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, floral hops, chocolate, coffee, pine and resin. Flavor is sweet, roasty bitter, very well balanced between roasted malts and floral hops. Smooth and well drinkable. Very nice brew.

330 ml bottle from Ales By Mail, served in a pint glass. Dark brown, pretty hazy with some sediments floating around, and a lovely, frothy and persistent light beige head. Great lacing. Quite distinctive aroma of both "worlds" well represented and easily recognizable: blood orange, resiny hops and pine needles on one side, bitter chocolate, espresso coffee and roasted malts on the other one. Very smooth and creamy, with a moderate citrusy bitterness and chocolaty aftertaste. Medium body and soft carbonation. Im not sure how old is this bottle (no date on the label) , but I would have prefered more bitterness and less sweetness. Overall, still a great BIPA.

Grifo. Vaso Nonic. Saboreada @ Cerveceria Freiburg (Barcelona). Brota con color ámbar muy oscuro y luces marrón rojizo a contraluz. Capa bronceada y encajes formados por una cremosa y persistente espuma. Aroma torrefacto con trazos de regaliz y resinas, notas de delicado cítrico y comino con sutil caramelo subyacente. Sabor torrefacto y caramelizado al primer sorbo que precede a un ascendente amargor cítrico, áspero y resinoso que lo inunda todo. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación suave. Textura oleíca. En el intermedio afloran matices de pan ázimo y húmedo. Un sabroso final amargo sobre un sólido lecho de maltas tostadas. Cítrico y resinas en el retrogusto. Refrescante y de fácil asimilación.
On-tap. Nonic glass. Enjoyed @ Cerveceria Freiburg (Barcelona). Pours very dark amber in color showing reddish brown lights. Tan head & some lacing on sides are made of creamy & lasting foam. Roasted aroma, hints of licorice & resins, delicate citric & cumin notes as well as subtle caramel on the back side. Sweet roasted & caramelish flavors at first sip then rising citric, earthy & resinous hoppiness flood all over. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Oily texture. Wet unleavened bread in the middle. Flavorful bitter finish on a solid toasted malty bed. Citric & resiny aftertaste. Refreshing & easy drinkable.

Cola coloured pour with a thick, light tan head. Aroma is quite big, roasty, citrus, chocolate, caramel. Taste up front is quite smooth, a little marmalade, then roasty; dark chocolate and resin bitterness at the end. Creamy mouthfeel, good strong bitter finish. Outstanding beer.
Bottle. Pours black with off white/cream head. Nose and taste of roast chocolate malt, bakers chocolate, pine, citrus peel, resin and chalky malt. Some cracker malt. Medium body.

Botella de 33 cl en cimmeria 18_01_14 en en momento. Aromas bastante tostados y quemados sabores también bastante tostados y quemados dejando al final un regusto amargo bastante seco y duradero. Cuerpo medio de color negro con espuma beige. Bastante buena y para repetir sin problema

Bottle from Beermerchants. Pours dark ruby with a big, stable and creamy beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, citrussy hops and caramel. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Taste is light roast, lots of fruity and citrussy hops, dry and hoppy finish, a really good one, moreish
Draught at Kaisla. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with hops, roasted malts, coffee, nuts and a bit of licorice. Bitter finish with hops, coffee and roated malts. Excellent black IPA.

Bottle from bieresgourmet.be webshop. Pours pretty much all-black body with a medium creamy off-white head. Aroma is wet grass, pine, fresh herbs, licorice and hints of citrus. Taste is grass, herbs, pine, coffee, chocolate, hints of red fruits and mild citrus in the back. Medium body and carbonation. Although its not painfully original, this is nevertheless a very solid BIPA from Beavertown.

Fruity berry like aroma from the hops with a tiny hint of choc.very deep brown with just of white head. Lovely big berry hop flavour and lightly roasted malts. Sweet flavours but beer is not sweet as such. Big bitterness is great but could be toned down a tad.

Pours out of the bottle in a deep black colour with steady low head and medium body. Nice aroma of fresh, aromatic hops and nuts. Taste of fresh, medium-bitter hops, leaves, straw, light malt, caramel, spices and herbs. Very bitter and medium dry finish. Enjoyed it a lot.

Bottle shared with McTapps. Nice mixture of some IPA moments and the counterpart in Stout. Hoppy one with a bit of coffee and easy drinkability. Citrus with chocolate and also a slightly bitter finish. Not a bad one. But also not a beer for a football evening.

330ml bottle. Pours a black-brown colour with foamy tan head leaving lots of lacing and aroma of tropical fruit & citrus resiny hop. Taste is sweet roast malty balanced against some grapefruit hop, resiny pine & earthy bitterness. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry roasted bitter finish. Very drinkable black IPA.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2015 Canned. Pours deep brown with a medium lacing, beige head. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, citrus, piney notes and a little peach. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily text. and soft carb. A great and smooth BIPA.

Bottle, Luvians, St Andrews. Black pour with a generous tan head. Aroma was choc, coffee and lovely piney hop. These themes carried on into the flavour in spades. Cracking hops , with some roast and dark fruit notes. Oh so drinkable. Top class Black IPA, really enjoyable.

Interesting aroma of summer fruits mixed with citrus hops which at first seems a little incongruous but stick with it. The rest is typical imperial stout territory - impenetrably dark with a buffy-red head, plenty of hops and a tang of alcohol. Liked it.
On tap at Biercab. Black colour with white head. Herbal hops, roasted aroma. Hoppy, bitter and roasted taste. Medium body.
Donkerbruine kleur met een volle creme kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop, gist, grape. Smaakt vol en bitter, hop, bitter, grapefruit en iets zoetig.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown/black with an off white head and a little visible fine carbonation. A fine looking beer. Lovely fragrant aroma - bread dough, pineapple, mango, hint of coffee. Medium to light body, medium carbonation. Treacle, coffee, tropical fruits, chocolate, lemon, tonic, grapefruit. Well balanced. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ Alesbymail. Pours dark brown nearly black with a small off white head. Vague roast, nuts, yeast, citrus, grapefruit and caramel. Smooth and medium bodied. Dry and hoppy finish. Tasty!

Bottled	London Brewers Market	30/11/13. A near black beer with an off-white head. A good Black IPA with a lovely sharp hoppy aroma. Good hops in the mouth. Some slick hoppiness with sweeter than usual malts. Very easy to drink. Good stuff. Impressive brewery this.

Not much of a head, dark dark brown.
Earthy aroma, brown sugar, stone fruits and toasted malts.
Flavours of dried stone fruits, milk chocolate, brown sugar. Citrusy hops and a nice light pine resin.
The finish is nice and bitter from the toasted malts and citrusy hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Decent block head beige colour dark pour soft carbonation aromas pine citrus rich malt floral caramel the flavours caramel toffee touch grapefruit peach medium strong bitter rich creamy note pleasing all the way needed something like this after a bad week the finish very crisp hoppy ale lovely resin touch good bitter and sweetness very good just missing a little body

Bottle from Oddbins, Blackheath. Black pour with a beige head. Citrus, blackcurrant and licorice aroma. Licorice toffee and Turkish delight flavour. Pleasant alcohol burn. Full on bitter finish. By thunder this is tasty!

Botella. Muy buena presentación astringencia de principio a fin, según va avanzando en trago aparecen notas dulces y café. Lúpulos en todo el paladar con un largo final seco y muy lupulado de larga duración.

Bottle, very nice label. Pours hazy dark brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma has lots of mango, grapefruit, strawberry, hops and only a little bit of roast and licorice. Taste has hops, some fruitiness, roast and licorice with a medium bitter finish. Medium body and carbo. Very nice stuff, but I prefer black IPAs with a bit more roast.

Bottled 33cl. ABV 7.2%. Dark brown/ruby color, good brownish head. Aroma has resin and some earthy toastyness. Medium bodied. Front is suprisingly sweet, caramelly then some resiny hoppyness, cough syrup and licorice. Light lingering hoppyness in the aftertaste. Sweetness, toastyness and hops are nicely in balance.

Bottle @ 2nd tuesday tasting. Aroma is big fruity hops, light roast, liquorice, caramel and more. Flavour is quite bitter and roasty covered in bitter fruity hops. Some liquorice notes. Highly drinkable. Great stuff!

Bottle shared at the De Molen monthly tasting. Pours dark brown with a moderate tan head. Aroma of roast, grassy hops, weeds, citrus and caramel. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Sample at the molen monthly tasting. 
Thin creamy head. Hoppy aroma. Hazy deep burgundy pour. Nice bitterness. Nice brew

Pours black with an off-white head.
Hoppy aroma of pine, fruit confectionery, soft roasted malt and caramel.
Roasty flavours with a fair bit of pine and grapefruit too leading to an aggressive bitter finish.
Nice moderate carbonation.

[Cask at Cask Days 2013.] Beer #19 of the fest. Pours brown with a spare long-lasting bubbly off-white head. Really nice aroma of dark malt, coffee, chocolate and lots of green hops -- this should be the model for all Black IPA aromas. Flavour of roasted sweet malt, a good amount of leafy hops, coffee and a moderate to big bitter finish. Alcohol totally hidden. Average to medium bodied. Very good stuff.

Where and how:  Cask Days 2013 
Aroma dark malts with strong backing of hops, hint of chamomile and tar. Mild alcohol felt in the aroma.
 Appearance : 
Top: medium plus sized , off-white lasting cap. No lace yet with rings on glass. 
Base: murky brown ale.
Palate :  medium bodied , soft textured. Lighter carbonation with long wet finish.
Taste: tad rough in its approach. Big raw citrusy (grapefruit) even spicy hop feel. Subdued sweet malts. Some alcohol heat.
 Other notes  rough but surely this will be delight for undiscriminating hop heads. I wish to see more balance here.

Bottle, 12C. Dark brown with a cm of light tan head. Aroma of zesty citrus, lychees, licorice, chocolate. Silky, lowish carbonation. Hard to believe its 7.4%. Fairly sweet mocha, licorice, light tropical and zesty citrus notes. Moderate bitterness leaves aromatics to linger. Very nice indeed.
Keg at Bat. Starts with rich chocolate and coffee before a pleasing bitter twang from hops. Closer to stout/porter than IPA on the beer sprectrum.
Brownie black. Aroma is hops. Taste is an extremely drinkable, sweet, lingering bitterness with hops, mild malt and a dry finish. Good Hoppy Black Ale.

.2l on tap @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours cloudy dark hazel nutty brown with medium stiff head. Leaves lacing. Aroma is hops, malts, coffee notes and fruits. Flavor is dark malts, chocolate and coffee notes. Some alcohol. Roasted palate.

2013-10-19. Muddy dark brown black body modest frothy brown head. 3+ Aroma is an interesting melange of green hops and malt. 7+ Flavour is pleasant, nice green hop bitterness over sweet malt core, moderate citrus character to the hops. Works pretty well. Average plus bodied palate with soft carbonation is great for cask. 3+ Very nice. (Rediculously drinkable - I had no idea it was this strong until I entered my rating!) Session 2, Cask Days 2013, Toronto

Bottle shared. Pours almost black with a brown head. Aroma is roast, coffee, vegetables, earthy and grass. Taste is nice and bitter with a light sweet malty backbone. Thick texture, medium to full body and soft carbonation. Excellent.
Nice roast malt and hops. Some coffee, dark cloudy pour. Bitter finish with the hops. Some malt. Nice balance. A little bit smokey, and the smoke integrates very well. Cask Days 2013.
Cask Days 2013. Solid black beer, with licorice, good malting backbone. Very drinkable, and lovely looking black cask beer.The trip over the pond went well.

Bottle picked up Tuesday 15th October 2013 from Jacks, Westholme Stores, Goring-on-Thames, Oxon, consumed at home Sunday 20th October 2013  Like the Tiny Rebel Fubar this was another beer that id had during my eight month period of semi retirement but hadnt bothered rating. As for the beer, well I rather enjoyed it, liqourice, chocolate and citrussy hops combine rather well in the mouth, its fruity and quite assertive. Dark brown in colour with a beige head. Nice beer. A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.5

330ml bottle @Cimmeria. Fruity and herbal aromas, some roasty ones. Pours dark brown with nice light tan creamy vanishing head, poor lacing. Medium body, silky texture, soft carbonation. Roasty and citrusy flavours, peachy, some grape. Creamy at palate, very pleasant fruity bitterness, well balanced with the roasty notes. A really enjoyable one.

A clear brown ale with a thin mocha head. In aroma, Smooth fruity malt with floral hops, resinous and smooth. In mouth, a smooth fruity biscuit malt with resinous and piney hops, restrained yet nice. Cask Days 2013.

Bottled, BB 28 Dec 2013, large sample. Dark color, medium brown head. Aroma of piney hops, grapefruit, citrus, roasted malts, slight grainy and biscuity. Smells greatly balanced between hops and dark malts. Quite bitter taste, slight dry, some sweetness from caramalts. Malts dont provide a lot of bitterness and its not roasty dry. Bitterness is mostly citrussy from the hops. Wonderful balance and very tasty.
Tap @ olutexpo. Black, brown head. Roasted, chocolate, malty, oatmeal. Coffee, roasted malt, hops, grapefruity bitter finish. Enjoyable bipa.-- rated with beerbasher

Black colour, red hue, tan head. Aroma of hops, caramel, coffee, citrus, grapefruit, liquorice and sweat. Hop bitter flavour, liquorice, salty touch. Salty finish, caramel, malts, coffee and hops. Nice!
(From 33cL bottle @ decadent symmetry tasting. Thanks for sharing, KyotoLefty!)
Wow this was a good beer, very smokey and roasty. Nice bitter finish. Great beer!

Nose is is toast, butter, biscuits, lemon, slight cream. Taste leads with pine, and grapefruit from the citra, leading through to licorice herbs smoke, ash, coco, pepper and roasted malt. Finish is long bitter and very dry, balancing the pine with ash. Mouthfeel is rich. 

Very nice beer. Still a stupid concept though.

330 ml bottle.
Pours a pitch black colour with a beige creamy head. Aroma of roasted malts, lovely floral hops, pine and wooden notes. Rich flavour of pungent floral hops, some citrus, licorice root, pine needles and some herbal notes. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and very soft carbonation. Lovely lingering bitter and floral finish. A top notch Black IPA.

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 26.12.2013. Thanks tiong!
Aroma is rather nice with hops, roasted notes, some coffee and cocoa. Also some gooseberry bush and biscuits. Flavour is resiny with hops, roasted notes, some ash and cocoa. Also some raspberry notes. Finishes with lingering hops and some licorice. Lovely.

Bottle. Very dark brown with a beige foam. Aromas are gritty cocoa nibs with grapefruit and earthy, woody pine. Creamy oak barrel with oil and earthy notes. Dark berries with floral, soapy notes. Flavours are dark chocolate with nutty notes and bitter grapefruit. Sudsy green pine with a peppery, almost spicy burn on the finish. Very good.

Bottle sampled @ decadent symmetry tasting. Nose of citrus, chocolate, licorice, some coffee. Very pleasant. Black with lace. Spicy, peppery flavor of chocolate, licorice, citrus. Crisp and light. A bit salty. Great peppery finish.

Courtesy of KyotoLefty. 33 cl. bottle sampled @ decadent symmetry tasting. Pours blackish dark brown with basically no head. Nose is that of grapefruit, pine, very hoppy with sweeter cocoa, light chocolate. Taste is bitter grapefruit & pine hops in a lovely way, malt base, slight roast, cocoa, coffee & touch dark chocolate. Touch less carb. Very easy to drink, another great beer by these guys.

330ml bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (£3.20):
Hoppy & bitter with tropical fruits aroma that consists of some peach, lemon and mild grapefruit with plenty of juices coming through too. There is some darker notes as well with a hint of chocolate and some roasted, sweet malts making an appearance too, as well as some sugar, liquorice and floral notes.

Black with a tall head that is a medium brown and creamy looking with great retention and very little in the way of reduction initially.

Mild bitterness with some grapefruit to kick things off with. There is some tropical fruits coming through too and definite caramel malts that give the beer some sweetness. Again more liquorice and hops with a further bitter kick plus sugar, citrus and strong fruits.

Medium bodied and quite bitter with a very juicy and fruity feel to the drink. There is moderate carbonation and the beer has a solid citrus tang to it throughout.

A pleasant taste with plenty of fruit and juices coupled with some darker flavours that made for a nice twist on the usual but it felt slightly over done with in some areas. Nice but probably not one Ill drink regularly.

Grapefruit and orange hoppy aromas with some roasted malt notes. The malt influence takes over more in the taste. Props on the bottle design. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from sourced market. Superb black IPA, maybe, probably the best I have ever had and I love black ipas. Its extremely well balanced with a great hoppy citrus to the nose but also a smooth roasted malt aroma too. It is extremely drinkable for the abv. Want to try on draft. This is so good, better than magic 8 ball. Highly recommend!!

Bottle from Sourced Market, St Pancras.
Poured a thick black with a dense, tan head. Aroma of pine hop resins, roasted malt and liquorice. Big, bitter citrus hop flavour with a good dark chocolate and molasses balance. Coffee, bitter hops and burnt malts leave a wonderful, lingering palate. Pretty darn special.

Doften domineras av ananas. Svagt rostat kaffe. Som vanligt har jag lite svårt för den här stilen, men om man blundar och anstränger sig lite kan man själv välja om man vill att det ska smaka ipa eller stout. Bara att välja

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2016 Keg at Andrew Ushers. Dark brown body with ruby highlights and a thick beige head that holds really well. Excellent lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, orange, dark chocolate and ash. Flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate and orange. Medium to full body with a smooth, luscious mouthfeel. Light fizz. A delicious Black IPA - packed full of ashy, roasted and tangy flavours. One of Beavertowns best.

Bottle. Pours a dark ruby brown color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty hoppy weak piney aroma. Roasted malty licorice hoppy bitter flavor. Has a roasted malty hoppy bitter licorice and caramel finish.

Bottle 33cl from Henrik many thanks. A black beer with huge off white head and good retention, lacing. Nose is on hop resin, coconut touch. Aroma is on dark chocolate with intense resin, pine wood and hazelnut touch, very bitter and clean finish on toasted hazelnuts, coconut and resin, floral, light citric touch, roasted malts. Quite unusual black ipa but very enjoying.

33 cl bottle. No BBE info.
Pours pitch black color with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma of roasted malts, citric fruits, hops, some licorice notes and faint goose berry bush. Flavor of roasted malts, hops, citric fruits and goose berries. Somewhat ashy dry aftertaste. Very bitter and harsh malty palate. Me likes.
3515

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2015 July 2013 - Cold bottle, black with a little head.  Smell - a little cat urine and fruit.  Body is medium.  Taste is very ashy with some decent hoppy flavours coming through. Bit of lime. (3.6)
Aug 2015 - Two 330ml cans, 7.4% canned just a few days ago.  About as fresh as humanly possible.  Re-rate on Leightons advice.  Black, big foamy tan head, light lacing.  Aroma is piney, earthy, mint.  Body is medium, a bit foamy, soft carbonation.  Taste is rounded soft roast, earthy, salty pine, mint and a little booze.  The hoppiness builds over time.  Enjoyable for sure.   (3.8)
010813. Bottle at home. Pours black with a nice head. Aroma nice crisp hoppy taste. Some malts into it. Very nice overall black IPA. Not Bad.

Very dark brown, practically black, with a decent light beige head. Aroma is floral hops, pine, grass, nutty, roasted malt. Taste is sweet with a nice bitter finish. Oily texture with light carbonation. Pretty good beer.

Okay this one is something special. Pours black, slight carbonation, keeps a thin head. Nose is citrus hops, promises to taste like an APA, but with burned malt woodiness. Taste is creamy burnt butter, coffee, treacle and citrusey hops, which shouldnt work but is so balanaced the bitter vs sour effect is bang on. Wow.
Bottle. Just had this with a slice of chocolate and courgette cake. Really rather good. I shall seek out more Beavertown.

330ml bottle - shared by VastActiv - thanks!
Nice hoppy aroma, bt good burnt roast. Ditto in the taste - delivers what it promises. Big and expressive. Finnish burnt and dry, but spicy hops too. Black IPA done right, an excellent dark hoppy beer.

330 ml bottle. 7.2%. Bottled 10/12/12. Courtesy of VastActiv. Thanks!
Black colour with a small creamy tan head. 
Fresh hops, moderate bitterness and roasted malt in the aroma. Delicious! 
The flavour is very nice with bitter hops and roasted malt. Very nicely balanced. Great brew! Bitterish hoppy aftertaste. This is the way Black IPA should be.

Bottle at Papsø.
Black coloured with a small beige head.
Roasted and hoppy aroma of pine needles and dark chocolate.
Roasted flavour of caramel, dark chocolate, hops and grass.
Hoppy finish.
Bottle 0.33l (via alesbymail). Colour is black with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, grape, hops and roasted malts. Great beer.

(Bottle, 0.33 l, courtesy of VastActiv, 20130713) The beer poured clear and almost black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had fruitiness, citricness and hint of roasted malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, citricness, mildly roasted malts, some burnt malts and medium bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy, burnt and bitter. A very good Black IPA but too burnt.

Bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a small beige creamy head. Aroma is resin, pine, spices, wood, caramel, toasted malt, roasted malt, nut, grapefruit, citrus. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft. Finishes dry, bitter with a lasting roasted note.
33 cL bottle. Pours hazy brown white tan head. Smooth grapefruity and peachy. Smooth fruity, peachy, mango and grapefruity. Toasted malty and light grapefruity hops finish.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2014 2013-12-01: 8+3+7+3+16=3.7 Bottle. Hazy dark brown close to black with an off white head. Tropical fruity nose. Light pine, bark, caramel, toffee, peach, light herbal. Medium/full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Medium sweet and medium/heavy bitter. A little alcohol in the finish. Good.


From can this time. Dark brown with a large light brown good lacing head. Powerful hoppy nose with pine, resin, grapefruit. Flavour is also hop dominated, but the darker malts make it soft and adds some caramel and roasted notes. Long hoppy finish. Pleasant and easy drinking, should keep this and Neck Oil in the fridge at all times.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear reddish brown with a creamy, beige head. Some perfumy aroma hops, somewhat greasy. Medium body, a little sweet roast and dark, dried fruit, again good aroma hops with a solid hop bite. 120713

Keg @ Stockbridge Tap [090713]
Dark brown, thin off white head, some laing
<btr>Aroma of floral hops, soft citrus, dark malts, smooth roast
Taste of grassy hops, dark malts, bit herbal, bit peppery, some piney hop, soft roast, some bitter chocolate, some espresso, complex flavour but not quite as good as the aroma, slightly harsh, alcohol quite noticeable
Palate - Soft carb, medium body. Finish - more floral hop in linger, then some grassy notes, quite bitter tail
Overall - Decent BIPA but not one of the very best

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2014 330ml bottle from Hippo Beers & can from Valhallas Goat. Thick black with reasonable head. Hop & caramel aroma. Sweet treacle hop flavour. Liquorice hop aftertaste. A decent black IPA.

12 ounce bottle

Thanks to Leighton for the bottle. I have been meaning to try a couple of Beavertown beers before heading home. Based on this data point they are not quite on par with the Kernel but no slouch either. I wish more breweries like this would make the trip to the US rather than more bland boring bitters that collect dust on the shelves.

Aroma / Appearance - The fluid inky base has a black edge. A vigorous pour gives it a nice tan head. Bittersweet chocolate malts, black coffee, and crisp hops create an edgy texture. It is different than what you get from an American black IPA but satisfying just the same.

Flavor / Palate - Malt, chocolate truffles, and black coffee hit the tongue in waves of rich flavor. A bittersweet hop texture transitions to a fine dry and creamy texture. It actually grows in intensity over time to have a strong bite by the end. If you make the trip to the UK and London dont overlook this brewery.

Bottle @ Christers. Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, rich citrusly hops. Flavor is malts, coffee, dark chocolate, citrusly hops, orangepeel, grapefruit, pine. Medium body, soft carbonation, lasting bitter finish. 030713

Bottle. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, hops, citrus and a little grapefruit. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, hops, medium sweet, grapefruit, pine and quite bitter.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Almost black with a dense light brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt and moderate hoppy - pine and fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 030713
Bottle. Nice creamy head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich hops, roast malt, chocolate, coffee, pine, flowers and grass. Nice and smooth.

My Bottom Line:
This Black IPAs roasted malts develop raisins and chocolate, a highly pleasurable profile interwoven with flavourful coniferous hops and their bitterness.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam tops the darkness.
-The mouthfeel is smooth and rich.
-Malts also offer caramel and hops create earth.
-This is a perfect rendition of the Black IPA, New World style.
-The flavour profile is rather complex.

Bottle.

33cl, new exclusive English brew Anno 2012, from The Bottle Shop Canterbury, complex bitter brew, fruity/bitter and slightly roasted/floral, very balanced, clear, good head, very good brew, yet expensive

Keg tap at Dukes Brew & Que, London on 1st June 2013. Deep brown - almost black - with pale brown head and lacing. Rich roasty aroma with plenty of spice. Exquisite roast malts in-mouth with coffee, citric notes and herbiness. Rich roasts and zesty citric notes with deep earthiness in finish. Medium body and zingy mouthfeel.

Hell yes finally a beer to sink my teeth into this week. This is way bigger than other BT brews Ive sampled. And all the better for it! Lovely dark pour with off-white quick leaving head. 330ml bottle. Pitch black colour with huge, creamy, fully lasting, eminently lacing, tan head. Excellent herbal hoppy aroma, peppery vegetable notes of green onions and carrot, a touch of roast. Intense BIPA nose of fresh mango and orange zest notes with pine and sweet malt threading through.  Pours well - deep brown with a full and firm head.
